review.title: Good Location. Public transportation convenient.
review.reviewText: I would stay here again. The hotel was conveniently located, the staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant served good quality food at a reasonable price. The room was clean and well maintained.

review.title: Very central
review.reviewText:
Good hotel to stay in clean friendly  & helpful staff
Within walking distance to most places

review.title: excellent location, nice hotel!
review.reviewText: No complaints other than $100/night incidental hold on your card they are. Or up front about! Other than that it was perfect!

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. The lobby was small but the staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The room was nice but a little on the small side. All amenities of the room were very nice quality including the TV, clock radio, pillows, bedspread, and sheets.  We had a 9th floor room with a view of Market street that was very nice but the second set of windows made it hard to take good pictures. The room was on the smaller side but it did not have a negative effect on our stay.   The staff was always helpful and I noticed that they would recognize me most of the time walking back to the hotel and even from behind the front desk, the doors would open automatically for me.
review.positiveRemarks: The best location, cleanliness, and staff were the best part of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The tub in the bathroom was slow to drain and the toilet handle came unhooked twice.
review.locationRemarks: All kinds of restaurants, shopping and the access to public transit were right there.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good staff. The location was perfect. Everything we wanted to see was within walking distance.

review.title: A great spot right in the city centre.
review.reviewText: This was a great central place perched above Old Navy, views of the city and easy to come and go from. Stayed 3 nights..  I'd stay again .
review.positiveRemarks: Position,views,well maintained.
review.locationRemarks: Right in middle of town at Powell St BART

review.title: Hotel Zelos was centrally located for our needs
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, respectful and helpful. The room was nicely updated and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the decor, the staff, The Dirty Habit!!,
review.locationRemarks: We were close to the Fairmont, The Sheraton, the Elks, the Marines Memorial.  A couple of hills, mostly flat walking. These places we wanted to see.

review.title: Great Hotel in Union Square for our 25th anniversy
review.reviewText: We ended our track from Seattle to San Francisco here for our 25th anniversary.  Great hotel cool bar on the 5th floor with outside patio.  This hotel is close to everything.  If you are flying in just catech the Bart down and get off at Powell  and Market St.  I/2 block walk from there.  You can walk everywhere or catch the street cars on Market St.  We went to Piano fight bar one night fun place great burgers.  In back they have burlesque shows didn't catch that but looked fun.  In front caught a great band playing 90's music.  Also hit a bar called Lefty's something great sung along Irish bar.
Everything was great except for the fact that parking at the hotel is 50 a night which was unexpected
Staff was great and a very quiet room. Walkable to a lot of great attractions and restaurants.

review.title: Beautiful room with all amenities !
review.reviewText: I'm from Humboldt County and don't travel much.  I got my Hotel Zelos room though an internet "deal".  Wow, I thought a 5 star hotel - what will it be like?  Answer:  Beautiful room with hairdryer, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, soap, iPod station, charging station, free Wifi, champagne between 5-6, and great coffee bar from 6 to 10 n .  Even thick fluffy towels and a big bathrobe to enjoy.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and I felt right at home.  i could not recommend it more.  When I arrived after  11 pm  from walking back from a musical, there was even a handsome doorman to greet me!  Very luxurious, yet casual and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant menu didn't look appealing so I ate somewhere else.
review.locationRemarks: I was there on business and didn't have much time to do anything else.

review.title: Great hotel with lots of walkable options.
review.reviewText: Really comfortable rooms, cool restaurant and we loved the decor of the hotel!
Great location.. It wasn't as clean as i wished.. Noisy if you stay in the 5th floor.
Nice a friendly hotel in the middle of all the shopping area. Nice rooms a modern twist on a classic hotel. Staff were excellent and welcoming.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Poor facilities. Blocked shower tray, cold water, no kettle in room. Tea, coffee provided only for a few hrs in the morning and cold. Room had a dysfunctional sliding door. Only good thing was close to Union Square

The only draw back was we could not check in at the check in time as our room was not ready.  We had been traveling all day and we were hungry and tired.  They did keep our luggage while we walked around.  They said they would call us when the room was ready and they did not.  They seemed very understaffed.  Otherwise it was a nice hotel.  Clean.  Slept well.  The staff is great!  Especially Luca.

review.title: In the center of town, close many attractions
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay, able to find and explore San Francisco from the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Position

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfect for just staying one night. Room was more spacious than I thought it would be. Bed was not too comfortable, but nothing I was too upset about. Was a bit noisey since it was right on market, but I expected it to be. Overall very good experience!

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: I'd requested a double bed but end up with a King bed.  The hotel even charges for a roller bed?

review.title: Central hotel
review.reviewText: Fabulously located hotel central to everything. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room lovely and comfortable. Lovely complimentary products in bathroom - most generous of all hotels we stayed in of equivalent or higher star rating.  Minor criticism - had to run the taps for a while before hot water came through! Tram, bus, underground stops literally around corner. Macy's, Armani etc just across the road.  Perfect place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location - could get to all main attractions in minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot water in rooms - very slow to arrive!
review.locationRemarks: Loads to do. Fabulous shopping, restaurants and links to travel systems. Well worth hiring bikes  - we cycled over Golden Gate Bridge. Alcatraz a must

review.title: Nice hotel close to Bart stn in heart of union sq
review.reviewText: Very nice convenient hotel well located very friendly staff good free wifi - fun bar on site - steps from Powell station Bart stop lots of shopping near by walk to sfmoma comfortable bed quiet on top floor lots of travelers from all over ............................,

review.title: Expensive but good.
review.reviewText: Hotel was great! I wouldn't bother going back to the restaurant though. Hotel is in a great location. Concierge was very helpful!

review.title: great hotel, great and friendly staff, clean
review.reviewText: A great time in San Francisco, on our way to a business conference
review.positiveRemarks: renovated , close to everything, helpful staff
review.locationRemarks: the only thing we weren't comfortable with, a lot of homeless people outside the hotel and the immediate area, we wanted to help, but so many of them

review.reviewText: Great location with amazing staff! Would recommend to my mother :)

review.title: Nice, hip hotel Union Square adjacent
review.reviewText: Stayed there with the family & the room was large enough & clean. Staff helpful & a good price point. May want to avoid staying on same floor as restaurant. It's open until 11:00 & there was a bit of noise.

review.title: Not worth the price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is overpriced and underwhelming. There is no lobby or materials about the city, the rooms are small and, unless you manage to get one that faces out, you are literally looking into the window of the room across you. Parking is $50/day and the hotel bar is windowless and dark. The whole experience felt like I was in a tomb for three days. Pay the higher price and get a hotel that has something to offer.
A wonderful getaway, centrally located, very pleasant and helpful staff. Cosy but clean and bright rooms (with excellent dark curtains for when you don't want all that light in the mornings :)).

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel. The maids not so much. They did not clean that good and one of them took the money I had on the night table and left a note like "thanks for the tip". I did not specify it was a tip. Overall the hotel is really good and the location is great is near everything, good restaurants, shopping places, movie theaters, malls, and its really close to the cable cars. It also offers good wifi!!

review.title: Don't go here if you have pet allergies!
review.reviewText: Apparently this is a pet friendly hotel and so if I had known this I would have avoided it at all costs. I am highly allergic and so it was hard to function here. Expedia should clearly list hotels as being pet friendly

photos.caption: Deluxe room, quite small but good enough

review.title: nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText: It's basically close to all the places I want to go. China town is 10-15mins walking, down the street is all high end brand stores.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Great place - didn't try the restaurant which looked really good

review.title: Excellent location friendly staff and stylish bar.
review.reviewText: Excellent location close to shopping and transport.
Stayed for 3 nights. Super location and nicely designed boutique hotel.

review.title: Great concept poor execution.
review.reviewText: My normal go to when traveling to San Francisco is the Mark Hopkins. This time I wanted to try something new a bit more hip then old school. The staff is amazing, kind, knowledgable and overall good people. The room not so great, office chair super dirty as pictured below the vents were super dusty. The only reason I looked was because my allergies were so agitated it had to be something in the room.  I travel with my hypoallergenic dog when we asked for a dog bed it came covered in dog hair. Mind you my dog doesn't shed and she refused to lay on that bed. Lastly No room service only breakfastI guess thats where it counts but was disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is amazing, kind, knowledgable and overall good people.
review.negativeRemarks: The room can be cleaned a bit better including the furniture . The robs size is: OS/L, trying carrying more sizes and extended sizes.
review.locationRemarks: Prime location with nearby restaurants and Starbucks since there is no room service.

review.title: Very nice hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: Excellent service and facilities, highly recommended

review.title: Great Gem in big city..
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a conference at Moscone. Hotel was 5 min walk and close to shopping and restaurants. Great location and staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was clean and comfortabke. Would stay again!
Pleasant weekend stay in SF, nice room in an excellent  location. Enjoyed Sun breakfast at the restaurant. No air movement first night in the room but quick response from hotel staff to get it fixed.
Small lobby, clean room, great location. Free water in lobby

review.title: Convenient, cute and moderately comfrotable
review.reviewText:
The hotel is just one of many that are on this new trend of firmer pillows and mattresses. This is the third hotel I have stayed in the last few months that have had firmer vs softer mattresses in their rooms.

Aside from the bed? The room was well appointed, comfortable and really? The bonus??? Those super plushy and comfy robes in the closet. I miss a good hotel robe and this one had one!! Another little thing I loved was the spa water and coffee service in the lobby. High quality coffee and the New York Times? Count me in!

The maid service was friendly, attentive, and I even got a little note. Would totally stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Robes! Coffee! Newspapers!
review.negativeRemarks: Softer beds... but that is just *my* personal preference.
review.locationRemarks: I love a good cup of coffee at Blue Bottle and walking around market street window shopping.

review.title: small size
review.reviewText: the hotel is modern and style is good, however your bed is 2.5 steps from the bathroom in the executive room, crazy! Its the smallest executive room I have ever seen. the windows wont open and the over all room is a small foot print. Only other room they told me was a suite, hate to see the regular room..
review.positiveRemarks: the bar was nice

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Comfy bed, good restaurant. The staff was really nice & attentive- but beware the $50 parking. ðŸ˜‰ lots of restaurants & shops close by- good for walking. I've tried lots of places in the area lately, this is the first I'd return to! Thanks for a great experience.

review.title: Hotel was great but maid service poor.
review.reviewText:
Spent 6 nights in Hotel Zelos and the maid service was sub-par.  Each day linens of various sorts were not replenished.  After a night or two of this I called the front desk and asked for clean towels.  They were brought up immediately but the problem continued through the rest of our stay.
The front desk staff and doormen were excellent.  I an not quite sure what the problem was with the linens but since I have traveled a great deal on business and pleasure - this was a first for me.  Once I can understand, but consecutive days - there is no excuse.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were newly decorated
review.negativeRemarks: Maid service needs to be greatly improved (at least on 9th floor)
review.locationRemarks: Location was great.  SFMOMA is close by as well as excelllent restaurants.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel but didn't love the area of town.

review.title: Nice hotel; very peaceful, quiet and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Great atmosphere, comfortable bed, bathroom included everything one needs, free wifi and thoroughly nice staff who look after you.
Location was excellent! No frills.a very good hotel and highly recommended

review.title: Fantastic boutique in the middle of retail nirvana
review.reviewText: The zelos is a fantastic urban property with one of the best bar restaurants in San fran

review.title: Convenient hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a nice choice if you want a hotel in the heart of Union Square.  Steps from shopping, movies, restaurants and only a block from BART.  The rooms are small but clean.  The restaurant and bar are trendy and hip and had a cool crowd/vibe.  It was $100 cheaper than most hotels in the area.  It targets 20-30 year olds so be prepared to have a hotel filled with that demo-  younger and enthusiastic- staying in the city to party and have a good time.  Some street noise.  We stayed here after a week in romantic Napa and sleepy Mendocino.  This hotel was neither romantic or sleepy but instead fun and energetic (As illustrated by the animal print robes in the closet).   Friendly staff.  I would not stay here with a family.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.locationRemarks: Union square, BART

review.title: well located, good value
review.reviewText:
we chose it because we had a conference (wisdom 2.0)  across the street
this hotel was a bit less expensive, smaller, you don't feel lost in the immensity of the larger hotels.
It doesn't have a lot of services . Have valet parking al day for $58, but don't need a car can walk everywhere
review.positiveRemarks: location, small
review.negativeRemarks: maintenance in side the rooms
review.locationRemarks: very well located

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText: The hotel doesn't match the 4 star criteria set out by Expedia, but what it lacked, for a business trip, I don't need.
Excellent last minute stay.  Clean, comfy, great body products in the bathroom.  No complaints!

review.title: Cute boutique hotel
review.reviewText: It's a nice enough hotel; it's small, doesn't have a lot of bells or whistles but it's cute.
review.positiveRemarks: The furnishings and general style
review.negativeRemarks: Offer parking or send info on parking to guest a head of time.  It was hard to reach staff and they were polite.

review.reviewText: Could not find my reservation, staff didn't know what to do.  Loud and noisy.  My room was not cleaned.  My desk chair was missing.
This hotel is at an amazing location, close to everything for walking! The bar is also outstanding and their food is delicious. I definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Friendly hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Zelos. We found the staff very welcoming and helpful and they were happy to check us in early. The location is great. A big Westfield shopping centre is next door and you can buy really nice home style cooked foods on the basement level at Bristol Farms. We had been travelling for a few weeks so were craving this! You are also right next to the cable car stop and historic street cars that go to Fishermans Wharf.
A very nice boutique hotel that is well-kept with friendly staff and superb central location at 4th and Market.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean well-kept rooms and very central location
review.locationRemarks: Excellent central location at 4th and Market

review.title: Ok, not at the level of a Kimpton
review.reviewText: This is a decent hotel in a good location. This used to be Kimpton's Hotel Palomar. If you stayed there when it was a Kimpton you're going to find things slightly amiss. It's just not up to the same standard. There were issues at check-in (due to some "computer issues" they had oversold a number of room types.)  Having said that, you can do far, far worse for more money. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall quality of the polish.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Hotel was just as clean as any other. The staff was helpful, and the hotel's located within easy walking distance of a variety of food/attractions. Only about 2.5 miles to fisherman's wharf. This hotel was waaaay cheaper than many hotels within a block's distance, and the quality was fine. Some of the reviews mentioned thin walls and noise issues. I had no problems with that at all; yes, you could hear some cars if they were repeatedly honking on the street or whatever, but you'd have had that problem in any hotel. General road noise was not an issue.
review.positiveRemarks: Value - didn't cost nearly as much as the others nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf and Lombard street are within walking distance. There's a ghiradelli ice cream shop 2 blocks away.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The staff here was exceptional.  Very friendly and helpful.  We were here for a girls weekend and had a room with two double beds and a view up the street of Union Square.  Our friends upgraded to a suite and it was REALLY nice and spacious.  The bar/restaurant "The Dirty Habit" was great.  Innovative cocktails and a very cool vibe.  We didn't try the food. (and boo! no room service)  The location was great...walked to nearby restaurants and shopping.  Didn't need a car, which is good because the parking/valet, like most other downtown San Francisco hotels, is very expensive...

review.title: Great option close to market
review.reviewText:
Really nice hotel, prompt curtious service, free wifi and fitness center.  Reasonable price.

Bed comfort was average.

One nit is that the hallway signage is poor, hard to find room, elevator, etc the first time around.

review.title: Nice hotel right on Market
review.reviewText: Lobby is small, but the rest of the hotel interior is great. The King rooms are very spacious, and I got an accessible bathroom, which is huge. The restaurant and bar in the hotel is quite decent, on the 5th floor and in their courtyard, has both indoor and outdoor seating, perfect for a group of friends. You might not want to call an Uber for pickup, since cars can't usually turn on Market St. Save yourself sometime and ask the doorman for a taxi.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Westfield shopping mall.

review.title: Great location next to the mall
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was very friendly and went above and beyond to accommodate our family it had a very nice location and was clean and I definitely would come back

review.title: Right on the edge of Financial District.
review.reviewText: Here on business, but was able to enjoy a couple of good restaurants and found lots of options for convenient and less expensive food, too.  Didn't go shopping, but lots of opportunity around. Nice hotel for center of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: New decor, loved the bathrobes.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Here on business. Close to office. Convenient with lots of food and shopping nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: New decor was nice, but I'm more of a traditionalist.
review.negativeRemarks: For a luxury boutique hotel, I think it could still offer some more amenties, like the Starwood hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping and restaurants. Financial District and close to Chinatown, Embarcadero and North Beach.

review.title: Right in the heart of downtown SF
review.reviewText: Here on business, but got to enjoy some of the restaurants and shopping nearby. Really good time, but brief.
review.locationRemarks: The Gap Superstore is downstairs. Westfield Center just down the street. Great restaurants are all over.

review.title: Great location for work
review.reviewText: Close to my office, nice decor, modern, close to great restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, location
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, Dining, Business

review.title: Here on business, so the hotel is close.
review.reviewText: Here for 2 days on business just down the street. Very convenient and comfortable.  LOVED the snazzy bathrobes!
review.positiveRemarks: location, decor

review.title: Friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText:
Everyone from the desk, doorman and the security guard is friendly and helpful. I had a situation where it was late and needed to buy dishwasher soap to clean milk bottles. Wallgreen and CVS were both close. I then asked the night staffs for help and they were able to get me a cup of dishwasher soap. 

The only down side to this place are the cleaning ladies. They walk around the halls chatting to each other very loud, slamming doors as they enter and exit rooms, and start knocking on peoples door at 6:30 am; which by the way sucks because my conference starts at 8am and I didn't appreciated being waken up that early.

review.title: great location, close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Spent 4 nights at Hotel Zelos. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Our room was close to the rooftop bar and restaurant and that was quite noisy. Otherwise really, no complaints.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, the bed and the room in general

review.title: Nice hotel with convenient location.
review.reviewText: The concierge was excellent.  She provide wonderful dinner recommendations (Credo being one) and good follow up.
review.positiveRemarks: Small European style, stylishly decorated and great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Promote your limo service to and from airport.  We accidentally discovered it outside the hotel.  It is better than Uber!
review.locationRemarks: Credo restaurant excellent.  Nice shopping close by.

review.title: Perfect location for downtown SF!
review.reviewText:
We had a wonderful experience at
Hotel Zelos. The hotel staff members were pleasant, helpful, and attentive to all of our needs. While the room was a bit smaller than expected, I could not have asked for a more comfortable room.

review.title: Assessible from BART and great value for the $$
review.reviewText: The staff was super friendly, the room was clean and quite spacious. Although not the hotel's fault, but the number of homeless on Market St. is growing, even inside the Starbuck's 1 block away.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room, friendly staff.

review.title: Central location in San fran!
review.reviewText: Great little boutique hotel in the right next to union square close to transport and shopping.

review.title: Not a 4 star hotel. But nice staff
review.reviewText: I came with high expectations because of the reviews, price, and 4 star rating. The staff was very nice but this is no 4 star. 3 star is more like it. I am staying at the palace down the street for the rest of my stay in San Francisco. It is much much nicer at similar price.

review.title: Great hotel, but a big noisy
review.reviewText: There was some construction going on during the night right outside, but the sound was muffled so it was not too bad.  Overall, a great place to stay.  Staff was super and very friendly!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Better price --- it was quite expensive
review.locationRemarks: Excellent locaiton

review.title: Nice, redone hotel downtown
review.reviewText: Nothing spectacular other than  the ultra helpful and accommodating staff. Just a very good, well kept hotel in a good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was a little noisy
review.locationRemarks: Too many things to list

review.title: Comfortable, clean hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: Good value for the price. There was a little glitch at check-in with the computer system, but was resolved quickly. Wi-Fi worked well in the rooms, though.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly renovated. Great location close to Market St, Union Square, Apple Store,Target, Moscone Centre and restaurants. Generous and quiet rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Location and price were the reasons for choosing Hotel Zelos.  I was quite pleased.  The staff were responsive to my few requests.  My roommate would have liked coffee/tea in the room; however, it was available in the lobby each morning.  I loved the water with lemon or lime infused in it, and refilled my water bottle there frequently.  And the hotel was a 5 minute walk from the hotel where most of the wedding festivities took place.
review.positiveRemarks: Enjoyed my stay here very much.
review.negativeRemarks: My roommate would have liked coffee/tea in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Loved the location in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: nice hotel near attractions
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Staff went above and beyond to recognize the celebration of our anniversary. So accomodating and helpful.

review.title: Great location, easy to get around the city.
review.reviewText: Very hot September! Good transportation system that helped us get around much quicker.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee/tea maker in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Trams,cable cars and buses right outside,easy access to all tourist spots.

review.title: In need of sprucing!
review.reviewText: Selected this hotel based on the ratings.  It was very disappointing.  The staff were very nice and engaging and friendly, but the hotel itself needs a facelift.  The grout in the tub was dirty...the rugs were dirty....the glass topped tables were scratched and gave the appearance of being dirty....staff was super friendly and nice but I wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: Absolutely the ideal location
review.reviewText: Near cabs, and all the public means of transportation. Ideal location!

review.title: Hotel was great!  The staff was amazing!!!
review.reviewText: Had an amazing time in SF and the staff at the hotel went above and beyond to make our honeymoon the best! Thank you all so much!

review.title: Wonderful staff!
review.reviewText: We were going to a nearby event for the evening.  I wanted a place to stay where we could walk to the venue & this hotel was literally right across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very helpful.  Mattress & pillows were dreamy!
review.negativeRemarks: We actually had a hard time getting here because of all the NO LEFT turn signs all the way here.  We ended up parking in the 5th Street Parking Garage
review.locationRemarks: We had a destination before booking & that is where we went.  There are tons of things to do in SF.

review.title: Hotel Zelos San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay in San Francisco at Hotel Zelos, however we were not advised that a new chain of hotels had taken over  and it was no longer Kimptons Palomar Hotel.

We booked a superior room with a wine tasting, because of the change of ownership things had changed and there was no wine tasting.  The reception did organise a bottle of preseco to celebrate my husbands birthday.

The hotel is situated in a good location and helped us to get use to getting around San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union square.
review.reviewText: Stayed for a few nights for business. Nice hotel with a great location.

review.title: Great boutique hotel!
review.reviewText: Staff is friendly and can't do enough to ensure your stay is comfortable and exceeds your expectations!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was always friendly and happy to make a recommendation for a restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: not a thing
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Union Square.

review.reviewText: Excellent location, wonderful staff. Would definitely stay here again!

Great location to the Westfield mall.
Nice larger room than we're used to getting in the City.  Friendly staff!

review.title: Perfect stay in a great location
review.reviewText: I don't have enough positive things about this hotel. The location was perfect, the staff was friendly, and the beds could not have been more comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: well located and very convenient
review.reviewText:
All was fine except for 10-25 minutes when we wanted to have a drink on the open patio and 3 restaurant staff made sure that we were not really welcome given the # of reservations they had that night
we asked of we could sit for 45-60 minutes and we would gladly move when reserved guests would show for dinner yet it appeared that even this was a problem
I guess it was a big ""thing"" to clean the table after 2 drinks........
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: larger beds

review.title: Good location for walking in city
review.reviewText: Restaurant and bar very limiting, no real place to relax in hotel but in your room. Lobby small, no attractive ara to sit in and have a drink, bar not open until evening, breakfast expensive, dining room on the fifth floor dark.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Decent and clean hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. It changed names from the time I booked to when we checked in. It was very challenging to get to the hotel with all of the construction going on in the city.
Great place. Very nice rooms and staff and close to BART and MUNI. Thumbs up!

review.title: Trendy hotel in very central location
review.reviewText:
This was a great hotel but seems to be suffering a few problems at the moment - maybe something to do with the fact it has very recently changed hands (and name! Which was very confusing to our taxi driver, who couldn't find it!). So this is now the Hotel Zelos!

Firstly, although I had booked this hotel 8 months ago, somehow my booking had been mixed up and they didn't have the room type available I had booked. I wanted a room with 2 beds - they only had rooms with 1 bed. Fortunately they gave us a 2nd room to use for free for the 2 nights, but it was still disconcerting the booking had been messed up when I'd made it so long ago.

The TV system was having issues. In both our rooms there would be times where you couldn't get beyond the main menu screen. Also they have disconnected the ability to connect your own devices to the TV to watch your own movies etc - this was annoying and we have not come across this in any other hotels. Presumably a way to force you to pay for movies to watch from their selection?

On the final day, although we were not wanting to use it, I noticed the restaurant was closed for breakfast because of a power failure. Almost feels like the name change is causing teething problems. Hopefully they'll get it sorted as the hotel is great and the rooms are beautiful.
Hotel has changef from Kimpton palmar  to zelos, so unfortunately Kimpton perks no longer available.

review.title: Good Hotel in great location. Food just OK.
review.reviewText: Stayed for three nights. Reception staff and front door staff excellent, very friendly. Sylvester the night doorman is one cool guy. Room and bed very comfortable. Location close to everything in this busy city. Disappointed with restaurant 'Dirty Habit', didn't rate up there for us compared to Melbourne (Australia) top class restaurants. Staff professional but not very friendly.Tapas type menu, quality of dishes OK but nothing special. (However lamb steamed bun was nice.)  Breakfast very average in the same restaurant. Someone needs to teach the staff how to use the espresso machine. We couldn't drink the strange latte. The percolated coffee wasn't very nice tasting stewed. The following night we went to a nearby restaurant (reception recommendation) - 'Sauce'. Food and service were excellent, probably the best dining experience we had in the three weeks in the states.

review.title: Exceptional Service!
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at the Palomar. The location is fantastic, and the staff is amazing! The mistake I made is that I didn't book through my corporate site and used Expedia, which means I didn't get credit toward my Kimpton Karma Rewards, which is a big ole bummer.

review.title: Central hotel ideal for seeing San Francisco
review.reviewText: We visited San Francisco as a family of 4 - 3 adults and a teenager - on our 25th wedding anniversary.  We booked a double double and asked for a quiet/high room which we got. Couldn't have been more quiet.  The room was huge and bathroom spacious so we were able to spread out over the 3 days we were there.  Not only were we warmly greeted on arrival, the hotel congratulated us on our anniversary and gave us a bottle of Prosecco & cup cakes which was a lovely touch. Our airline lost our luggage until our last night in San Fran and the staff at the Palomar were very concerned/sympathetic and helpful which was much appreciated.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly & helpful staff, spacious & clean room with comfortable beds. Our room was very quiet and well furnished. Good transport links.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much! The carpets were a bit tired. Breakfast was a bit expensive for 4 so we didn't use this but it would have been good to have had this.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. We used the BART from the airport which was veasy. Close to trolleys and street cars but away from the tackier/touristy side of SF

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText:
5 nights at the Palomar
Great location, walking distance to pretty much all you need in San Francisco
Union Square 5 minute walk
China Town 10 minute walk
Pier 39 about 30 - 40 minute walk
Helpful and friendly staff, free wine tasting in the lobby every day between 5pm & 6pm
Dirty Habit cool bar open until 11pm 
Rooms were ok, possibly a little tired but were clean and spacious
Overall good hotel, great location, rooms needed a little updating and it would be perfect

While there is a difference between Aussies and Yanks and tipping, I do acknowledge in USA to tip and do tip, so he can shut it really. needless to say the doorman did not get a tip for A) not opening the door for us (even though I am capable and do not need someone to open a door for me and really wouldn't want to tip of for this useless service), B) why tip rude service,

review.title: Convenient and interesting refuge
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Palomar several times.  The location is convenient.  It is close to meeting hotels, the convention center, shopping, and transportation.  The hotel restaurant becomes a lively and at times over crowded scene at night, but this hasn't been a problem, even when I've stayed on the same floor.  The Kimpton hotel amenities of a glass of wine at 5 pm and morning coffee in the lobby are welcome.  It is fun to talk to other hotel guests in the evening or to take a glass of wine to the room and kick back.  The staff is accommodating, relaxed and pleasant.  I've particularly enjoyed this hotel as a refuge from the press of conference hotels when I've been attending a meeting nearby.

review.reviewText: Perfect location for a quick weekend getaway to San Fran. From the hotel we walked just about everywhere we wanted to see. Room was very comfortable, clean and staff was pleasant.

review.title: Staff and location make this a great place
review.reviewText:
You can't beat the location if you want to experience a lot of the highlights of SF, albeit the more touristy ones. It's just off Market Street, within reasonable walking distance of AT&T Park, the Ferry Building, Embarcadero, Yerba Buena Center, Moscone Center, Westfield Mall, cable cars and even Chinatown.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a nice sense of hospitality you don't often get in the larger chains, but I have found that with all the Kimpton properties where I've stayed.

Out of convenience, we got breakfast at the hotel. It was a fairly standard breakfast menu, but very reasonable in terms of price, especially in a city like SF where prices tend to be high. I would stay there again for sure.

review.title: Too loud
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel based on the reviews and upon arrival I thought the hotel seemed nice. Once I entered my room it was quite small. 

In the night my family and I couldn't sleep as our room overlooked the lounge/bar. I couldn't believe how loud it was!  It was soo late and everyone was exhausted. It was soo loud until late in the night. 
 
Upon check out no one asked me how my stay way. I was quite disappointed. 

I felt terrible as my family made me feel awful for making this booking and it was not worth the $$$.

review.title: April showers in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was the first time I stayed at this hotel. I was able to take the Bart from the airport to the Powell Station and walk a short distance to the hotel. Since it was raining when I arrived, the closeness to the Bart Station made the challenge easy. There is an umbrella in the room, which came in very handy during my stay. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.The hotel room was average in size compared to other hotel rooms that I have stayed at in this city.There is a card in the room that states" if you forgot it ,we have it"; toothpaste, toothbrush, razor, shave cream, electronic chargers etc. the list is extensive. There are plush terrycloth robes in the room for guests to enjoy. The hotel also offers complementary coffee & tea in the morning and a wine bar from 5:00 pm- 6:00pm in the evening. This hotel has created a very pleasant environment for their guests. I would recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has nice amenities and is very friendly. The complementary coffee in the morning & wine bar in the evening is a nice touch.

review.title: Conveniently located hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Only a few doors from Market Street and a couple of blocks from the cable car terminus, this hotel is very conveniently located for exploring San Francisco.  Reception staff are friendly and helpful as are the door staff.  Cleaning staff are cheerful and do an excellent job.  Wait staff in the restaurant are friendly and efficient and although more expensive than in diners nearby, breakfast is reasonably priced and plentiful.
Our room was big enough for the two of us with a huge and very comfortable bed.  Curtains effectively kept the light out and helped us get a good night's sleep.  Being on the ninth floor there was little or no outside noise.
Be sure to ask at reception for a map of the city.  It will be bigger and better than those found in any small guidebook.

review.reviewText:
Our room was facing a restaurant patio so we could hear lots of noise from the patrons until around 11PM or midnight. review.title: Prime location & Cool Vibe
review.reviewText: Great stay at Hotel Palomar last weekend with my sister and our girls.  The hotel was in a prime location, walking distance to the Ferry Building, Union Street shopping and more.  Loved the cool vibe with quirky art splattered around the hotel.  The room was spacious and clean.  It was a bit noisy in the morning...I think we may have been near the laundry facilities.  The sink & shower did not drain very well but housekeeping came to fix it as soon as we called.  The Dirty Habit restaurant/bar was delicious and the outdoor patio/fireplace was breathtaking.  Customer service throughout the hotel from the Dirty Habit, housekeeping, the bellman and the front desk were top notch with the exception of the on-duty manager, Whitney.  She was condescending and rude to us on a number of occasions...including speaking poorly about me in the presence of my daughter/niece when I went to the garage to locate a bag that was misplaced by the bellman.  All in all, we had a very pleasant experience and will definitely return next time we are in the city.

review.title: Close to SHOPPING
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at the Hotel Palomar, but if you are looking for a hotel with ANY amenities (free wifi without having to join the Palomar "Club", a pool, free breakfast, etc.), you might be better off with a more traditional hotel in San Francisco. The staff at this hotel was EXTREMELY helpful with our numerous questions and never hesitated to suggest restaurants, transit routes, etc. Just awesome with all of that! This hotel is pretty swanky in a low-key kind of way. When you walk out the front door of the hotel, you are inundated with shopping choices. There's too much to even describe here. It's centrally-located and within walking distance (if you want to walk) to MANY cool SF sites. The other ones can be reached by public transportation.

review.title: SF Getaway
review.reviewText:
One of the best things about The Palomar is the location, the corner of 4th and Maket is the center of the SF universe. If shopping is your thing then you can't go wrong. Want to head down to the Ferry Terminal and browse and eat, hop on s steet car and you're there in 10 min. Chinatown is only a short walk as well. For a real San Francico treat que up for the Powell/Market cable car line that runs all the way to Fishermans Wharf. 

Back at the hotel the staff is very friendly+ attentive,  and contribute to the youthful vibe of the property.  Each morning you can stagger to the lobby for your morning coffee to go, and each evening stop at the lobby on your way out to paint the town for a glass of wine - both complimentary. 

For as busy as the area is its easy to find a quiet room and a good nights sleep - even on New Years Eve. The rooms are clean and comfortable, although a bit small. There are a few more scuffs and scratches then the last time I visted when the hotel was new 12 years ago- but overall The Palomar has been very well maintained. Keep in mind the hotel is pet friendly, so if you have a problem with meeting a dog or two in the lobby or knowing Fido may have also slept on your bed this may not be the place for you.

review.title: Not your dream stay - Nightmare in Union Square
review.reviewText: Without a doubt, the worst possible experience one could have for any hotel. It was dark, dingy, dirty, and terribly small, not to mention unsecure (no deadbolt on the room door). I am at a loss for words to truly describe how disappointed and "ripped off" I was. After the first night, we asked about switching to a larger room, but were told we would have to wait until noon the next day before changes could be made. Needless to say, we were ready at noon to see what our options might be, but the front end manager kept stalling. By the time we finally saw another room (around 2 pm) and decided it wasn't any better, we decided to go to another hotel. If we had stayed, we would have had to live out of our suitcases for the six days because there was no place to store our clothes in the room. In addition to being the worst possible experience, I canâ€™t think of one redeeming quality of the hotel or our stay. We did not sleep well that first night because the mattress was as hard as a rock, the room was not properly secured, the temperature of the room could not be controlled, and noise from the restaurant on the floor below was excessive. I doubt that I will ever stay at another Kimpton Hotel. It is hard to understand how other travelers can provide such positive reviews. All I can imagine is that they are either very inexperienced or have very low expectations. I have traveled extensively, and I know what a dump is when I see one.
