I feel that hotels should disclose when they are remodeling and offer a reduced rate at least, but oh well. Location was hotel was great as it was right in the thick of everything. Trip was still good.
review.negativeRemarks: Disclose remodeling status
review.locationRemarks: Right over the mail mall and nearby great places to eat. There was an excellent Indian place a couple of blocks North.

managementResponses.response: Sorry about the challenges you experienced. Since your last stay, the lobby is complete, the restaurant is nearly ready to open on May 1st, and our brand new outdoor patio/dining space is complete. Please join us again in the future and I am confident we will earn back the full 5 stars. Truly sorry things were not tip top for you back in March.

review.title: Very disappointed!
review.reviewText:
Purchased the hotel through the unpublished rate as a 4 star. I am super disappointed and want to hear from someone at expedia pls.

1) the hotel bellhop was super condescending and rude
2) the hotel lobby was in shambles and empty and in the middle of a massive construction overhaul
3) the interim lobby was on the 9th floor and checked in - everything was a complete make shift mess
4) at 9 am the next morning they had serious construction and chainsaws right outside our door. The entire floor I was staying on was torn to shambles - even the drywall torn out
5) the following night/morning someone from the work staff opened out door at 5 am, saw that it was not vacant and turned around and ran out.

This hotel should have been closed for this level of repair. I was shocked and appalled that this happened

managementResponses.response: Glad you enjoyed our location and great service team. You'll be happy to hear mess is almost all cleaned up and our restaurant is scheduled to re-open on May 1st and the lobby will be fully back by April 10th.

review.title: Great Place to Stay for Moscone
review.reviewText: If attending a conference or the like at Moscone this hotel is a great choice. Less than other hotels further from the convention center, very clean and silent rooms. Staff is very friendly. Currently being renovated in the lobby so a little messy there but when finished will just make this hotel all the better!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the 5 Star rating. Renovations are just buttoning up and we will be better then ever. April 10th the lobby will be re-opened and May 1st the restaurant will be opened.

review.title: Great hotel and staff
review.reviewText: Great hotel, lobby is undergoing renovations and reception is on the 9th floor. Parking is very limited in the area. Overall is very good stay!

managementResponses.response: Sorry you had to experience the renovation project. The lobby will officially re-open this week, yet sadly you were here during a hectic stage as the contractors tried to button up the final details. Please join us again, as I am sure you will be amazed by the finished product.

review.title: In renovation! Noisy and tore down.
review.reviewText:
In renovation!
Noisy and tore down.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for joining us. The wine bottles are getting ready to be corked an poured in Kimpton fashion next week as we eagerly re-open our new lobby. Sorry things were a bit rough around the edges during your stay, yet please know we are coming back better and more beautiful than before. We look forward to seeing you again. Thanks for your continued loyalty to Kimpton.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed at several Kimpton hotels before and they have always been great. Unfortunately, during the time that we were there, the lobby was being renovated which included having only a narrow path from street to elevator doors, much noisy equipment running, dirt and dust, and check-in relocated to a room on the 9th floor. A plus at these hotels is the daiily wine reception which certainly lost something since there was no lobby available. Typically, there is staff pouring wine which we did not find this time - just bottles set out. I think the fact that there was construction should have been noted when we booked the hotel. The room itself was fine and it's a great downtown location, close to the BART, shopping, etc. We were told construction would be done on Monday - it wasn't even close.
review.positiveRemarks: Good downtown location. Nice to have coffee available in morning and wine in the afternoon.
review.negativeRemarks: Notify people when construction is going on in the hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Downtown. Close to cable car and BART, lots of shopping, nice mall, Union Square.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the 5 star rating and the praise of Kimpton! Hope to see you back soon.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: We chose to stay here because of the central location, being on Market Muni line, etc, we'll definitely go back because of the service. We decided to stay here for our anniversary weekend, when the staff found that out, they kindly brought a bottle of bubbly and a personalized card to our room. This is nothing out of the ordinary per se, but only the Kimpton's are consistently so thoughtful. Regarding the location and not the hotel, Market Street can be a bit sketchy at times, especially after dark so if you aren't used to seeing people sleeping on the sidewalk at any time of day, or hookers of all varieties after dark you might want to stay on Nob Hill (or avoid SF altogether).
review.positiveRemarks: Service, location, comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: We went during the tail end of a renovation, they were in the process of redoing the lobby and front desk.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square 2 blocks away, Chinatown about 8 blocks, the Ferry Building a few blocks away, and on a Muni line and a Bart station out front.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us. Indeed the new lobby will be fantastic. It is actually just a few days from completion. We are set to start to move back in this weekend on March 16th. Sorry you had to experience some of the dust. Please join us again soon.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We've stayed at Kimpton hotels before, so knew of their high quality. The lobby was under reconstruction, but we were checked in right away, even though we were 3 hours early. Staff we're very warm and personable. Room was quite small, but clean and comfortable. A nice stay!

managementResponses.response: Indeed you were here at our worst and I am hopeful you will join us at our best. The lobby is scheduled to re-open next Tuesday (March 11th) with incredible artistic elements that will certainly impress. That said, I also know that better communication could have been done and I am sorry we caught you off guard with our renovation. We reached out to many of our booking channels, travel agents, and on-line travel agents yet it is clear more could have been done. I realize that although we are nearing completion this does not resolve that you were here among the dust. I am incredibly sorry.

review.title: Everything on the Palomar website is fictional.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a construction site. There are no restaurants, no lobby, no reception area, no room service, and only a makeshift fitness area. Very unappealing. Moreover, the hotel has no interest in telling its guests AHEAD of time of this. It merely offers a belated apology, at best, and free coffee as if to say "Oh this bothers you? We are sorry. We didn't think construction would take this long." Oh come on. This is no excuse. We would have appreciated a call or a note on the website suggesting it's portrayal of the hotel did not exist. Construction is expected to continue until May on the fifth floor (so stay away from the rooms on the sixth floor) and the end of March at best for the lobby. I can't tell about the restaurants. So, a word of warning to future guests--if that's all that management thinks of you, don't expect more when you get there. In addition, the hotel is located just on the fringe of Union Sq, where it abuts an area of a much higher population of unfortunate homeless people. So the location isn't great either.
review.positiveRemarks: Very little. It is really a three-star, not four-star hotel. The Etro toiletries were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Management could be honest about the state of the hotel before you get there.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping in Union Square.

managementResponses.response: Sorry for the renovation surprise. We were hopeful the lobby would have been complete prior to your arrival, yet it looks like we are about two more weeks from the re-opening of that area. It would be wonderful to have you back and experience us when we are back new and improved.

review.title: Construction site
review.reviewText:
The lobby was non existent, the way to one functioning elevator a hallway build out of tarp and black painted plywood, the reception on 9th floor a repurposed hotel room. Restaurant and bar in hotel were closed. The first room we got had continuous drilling and hammering noise. 2nd room was ok but with the open nuts, dirty t-shirt and used soaps of previous guest. I used to like the Kimpton chain but feel completely cheated since there was no price reductions or discount, nor any indications on the website that the hotel was under construction. If I would have known I would have chosen a different hotel (as did the couple arriving with us that moved out right away). Construction going on for at least 2 more weeks!
I think Kimpton should give their guests a choice rather then alienate them.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for your willingness to try us again. As you know, we have a new lobby and restaurant forthcoming, along with some nice enhancements to our guest rooms and public space. I am confident you will love the new restaurant. There are some surprise elements being built that will be sure to impress.

review.title: Valentine Day's getaway
review.reviewText: Frequent travelers to San Francisco and hotel has an excellent location, close to union square and public transportation. Hotel staff was great. Although they were remodeling the front desk and dining room, the hotel was a bit run down. The bed in the room was descent to sleep on even when we heard some springs go boinggggg a few times. Read some great reviews about the hotel but not sure we will try it again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Better beds, cleaner rooms
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, transportation and dining

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and your feedback. Consider the kick received. I am working diligently wit the team to address your concerns. In a few weeks, many enhancements to the hotel will also be complete, including new restaurant, bar, and lounge along with our new lobby.

review.reviewText: Sloppy service way below expectations. Single PC for business purposes did not work. I was told this when I checked in on the Sunday night, and it was still not working when I checked out on Thursday morning. Where are we? Russia? Bar was closed for a private event on the monday night. Could not get drink or entertain customers at the hotel. Room card key need reprogramming twice. On Wednesday night bar opened at precisely 5:00 pm as customers were kept waiting outside the bar area. Awful! Staff handled all this well, it is the management that needs a good kick up their backsides, and smell the coffee. Will not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Mgt!!
review.locationRemarks: Go for drink because the hotel bar was closed.

managementResponses.response: Glad you had a great stay. Indeed our location is fantastic. Hope to see you back again soon to enjoy our new restaurant, bar and lounge along with other great service and product enhancements.

review.title: Nice hotel in excelent location near everything!
review.reviewText:
Location is wonderfull near Museums' restaurants, Union Square, all tipes of public transport at one block distance from the hotel. Nice very comfortable bed with excelent linens. Very confortable. They offer morning coffee or tea for hotel guests and algo wine at 5pm which is a very nice detail in the San Francisco tradition.
Staff were very friendly and helpfull specially Marie and the asian guy in the evenings! Also Matt at the door was very nice and helpfull.
Overall a very nice experience after being there for 7 nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: There was a closed armoir that seemed to be a minibar. It would have been extremely nice to have it open in order to have some personal stuff
review.locationRemarks: Already explained

review.positiveRemarks: Excellent friendly staff, clean rooms and lobby, proximity to everything
review.negativeRemarks: Room is small, but that is to be expected for this area.
review.locationRemarks: Took BART from SFO and just walked a block to the hotel, then took MUNI to just about everywhere. Felt safer here than places closer to Union Square.

review.title: Excellent location, quiet
review.positiveRemarks: Good quality, superb location (close to BART which makes airport transfer easy), very quiet
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice to have windows that open but that's not going to happen
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for shopping, easy access to ferry terminal, cable cars, trolleys along the Embaradero to Fisherman's Wharf, walking distance to Chinatown, Nob

managementResponses.response: Gotta love a 5 Star Rating ....our team loves to serve. Glad you were here!

review.title: Girls weekend away
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a fantastic location! We walked everywhere and were in the center of everything it seemed. The hotel staff were super helpful and welcoming. Dino at the front desk gave us great suggestions every day which allowed us to experience the best of San Fran!

review.title: Convenient location & excellent staff
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our stay at the Palomar. Staff were very friendly and helpful, location was prime, and given that it was a smaller hotel, there was never a long wait for the elevators just to get up to your room. The refreshing lemon water in the lobby, morning tea/coffee and afternoon wine was a nice touch and greatly appreciated. The hotel's dog "Maverick" was a hit with the kids and the staff even delivered minature Maverick stuffed animals to our room which was very sweet.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly service, small boutique feel
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient, right by BART Powell station, Union Square, shopping, Whole Foods nearby

review.title: A quiet haven in a busy city
review.reviewText:
Travelling solo for a conference, I really enjoyed staying six nights in this great location close to the Moscone Centre, in a smaller hotel, with really friendly staff. Front desk was well staffed - no delays at any stage. The doormen were lovely - special thanks to Alex, who was on when I arrived, and Matt who organised a superb car service to get me smoothly to the airport on departure, at a discounted price that made it no more than a cab fare.
My room was spacious, comfortable, and amazingly quiet, given the level of noise in the street outside. Even though I was on the floor where the bar and restaurant were located, the noise hardly penetrated my room. The air conditioning was very silent, and the temperature easily set to a comfortable level. The shower was great, and the bath tub allowed a soak after long days of walking. It is a great city for walking, and the location makes it easy to see many different areas within an hours radius.
Being a yoga and pilates type, I loved the complimentary yoga mat and the TV channel that allowed me to spend 30 minutes following a routine. The free bike is a great idea too, but I was not brave enough to try the streets of San Francisco on two wheels!
I only ate once in the hotel, and breakfast was fine. Free coffee in the morning was nice, and the wine tastings looked like great fun, although I had too many engagements outside the hotel to join in. I would definitely stay here again if returning to San Fran
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff friendliness, comfort, quiet, in room health and wellbeing channel plus yoga mat.
review.negativeRemarks: Fruit at breakfast (was a bit tired and tasteless)
review.locationRemarks: Moscone Centre, shopping, Union Square, public transport.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Very disappointed with the cleaniness of the property and lack of amenities. Atrium carpet was noticeably soiled and other carpet throughout the hotel needs to be cleaned. Glass top table in hallway on the floor was not clean, very dusty with smudges. Upon returning to the room late in the evening after housekeeping cleaned the room, the bed was not completely made up and had to call housekeeping. Expected a sofa and chair in the room like the room across the hall from ours. Expected WiFi. Lot of homeless sleeping as you enter and exit the front entrance, which is heartrending. Expected more and would not stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very nice and the daily wine reception and coffee/tea in the mornings was a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Detail clean common areas and carpets. ( atrium, hallways on floors, interior & exterior of elevators, entranceway doors). WiFi in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Very nice location--shopping, dining and various modes of travel to get around the city (cable cars, trolley car, bus) in close proximity.

review.title: Comfortable hotel next to shopping and restaurants
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar is perfectly located, with friendly staff, comfortable rooms and is a great base for exploring San Francisco. We will definitely stay again when we next visit SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, great location and free wine tasting for an hour each day is a great addition to the hotels offerings.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be great if the hotel were a little cheaper, but that is San Francisco and one of the draw backs of going to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for shopping with Union Square very close by and Westfield shopping centre next door. Great bars and restaurants within walking dist

review.title: Unbeatable location!
review.reviewText: We still can't get over how convenient was the location of this hotel for those in town that want to do a mix of tourism/shopping and dining. The staff was very helpful when we requested information on how to get around or tours. It is about one block away from Union Square so it is in the middle of a very safe and lively part of town. There are several cable car lines going thru the corner of the hotel, also bus lines and a subway.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, service, cleanliness, attention to detail.
review.negativeRemarks: The curtains in the room needed to be replaced.
review.locationRemarks: You can go shopping to Wesfield Centre next door, Forever 21, H&M and Apple across the street, Union Square, Target, Saks, Neiman, Macy's..etc

review.title: Great Location Easy to Fly & BART
review.reviewText: Easy place to get to Via airport and BART to the Powell St. Station

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Staff were amazing especially Dino on front desk, so helpful,thoughtful and kind. Also Kelsey was a lovely lovely person. :)
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Tea making facilities in the rooms

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Good experience. Would go back without hesitation.

review.title: Great location for public transport n shopping
review.reviewText:
The receptionist did not give much info about the facilities available in the hotel.
Justin the concierge on the other hand very helpful. He advised us about the happy hour from 5:00 pm to 6:00 pm n also the coffee machine.
Coffee machine was great n really welcome in the room.
The coffee flavours were great too.
Great central location
review.positiveRemarks: Location location location
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff to give more information out about signing up for wi fi loyalty programme, happy hour.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, cable cars, good restaurants , public transport .

review.title: Lovely stay
review.reviewText:
The concierge staff was fantastic! I wish I could name everyone but I can tell you that Josh and Midelle made excellent dinner suggestions ( and reservations for us) as well as an excellent winery tour recommendation . The door men were also very welcoming and helpful (Mark, Richard).
We had a minor room glitch with a blinking ceiling light but they took care of it and sent us a lovely bottle of wine and chocolate for our inconvenience. I would continue to stay at Kimpton Hotels because of the very kind (and cater to the customers) staff. The daily morning coffee bar and daily wine reception is also a welcome touch!
review.positiveRemarks: Courteous staff that are extremely helpful; room was very comfortable; wine reception
review.negativeRemarks: Muffins would be nice in the morning with the coffee.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed at an excellent location right off Market Street and 4th St.. Westfield Mall was around the corner. City transportation was easy

review.title: Top location
review.reviewText:
Very well located. Close to all transport and shops.
Great restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee shop. No tea coffee facilities in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location. Close to everything.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: loved this Hotel. Have been to SF a few times now and can honestly say Hotel Palomar is one of the best we have stayed in. Rooms are big and spacious. beds and pillows comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful and its always a bonus seeing "maverick"the resident chocolate lab at reception.
review.positiveRemarks: Size of the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Handy location for shopping and easy assess to cable car and public transport

review.title: Great location, comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: The Palomar is in a great location in the shopping area. Easy walks to the Powell St cable car terminus and other transit links to Fisherman's Wharf and the bay. The room we were in was a little small and noisy due to road work in Fourth Street (July 13) but the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we've slept in. Recommended and would stay again.

review.title: Wonderful Location
review.reviewText: Location, location, location..... close to Market Street and all the many stores, and Union Square is just a short walk away. It`s also close to public transit including the F Streetcar which quickly (and cheaply) takes you to the Embarcadero and Fishermans Wharf. Furthermore, there are numerous eateries in the area. The hotel was very clean and well maintained - we loved our nice quiet room overlooking a small courtyard - and the staff were extremely helpful. The complimentary morning coffee and evening wine was a nice touch. Would certainly recommend the Palomar to others and would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to shops, transit and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish they had muffins or pastries to go with the coffee in the mornings!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect - close to everything.

review.title: Nice hotel in busy part of SF
review.reviewText: Went for a 4 day stay. The hotel was nice and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The room was a little small but that was alright for us. The hotel is right in the middle of a lot of shopping being that it is located on 4th and Market. We went to a Giants game and walked to and from with no problem, it is about 8 blocks and the park is beautiful. We did not go to the restaurant so I can not comment on that. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only thing that was a little bit of a downer is paying, I think it was, $50 a day for parking but that is also SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness and nice, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe not improved but the parking rate per day is steep.

review.title: Good Hotel for Shopping in San Fran!
review.reviewText:
Hotel Palomar has a great staff, wonderful beds and a nice quiet room. It's a great location for shopping and business, probably not as good to see the touristy stuff. Nice robes and a yoga mat available in the room. Wine tasting was just okay, not great wine, but it was free, so who is complaining! So the hotel was a thumbs up, but read below for issues with getting around SF.

I thought the mass-transit would be decent in San Francisco, but I WAS WRONG! We waited about an hour to get on the F bus (it was supposed to run every 15 minutes) to the wharf and almost as long coming back - ridiculous! Cable cars were expensive and the ticket guy was rude.
So be prepared to walk or take cabs...
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff!
review.locationRemarks: Best for shopping, touristy stuff is rather far.

review.title: Very Good Location
review.reviewText: ShopsThe Hotel Is Very Quiet And Very Clean. The Restaurant On The 5Th Floor Was Impressive For A Hotel Restaurant.The Lication Is Perfect. It's In The Middle Of All The Action, All The Shops And Very Close To The Cable Cars.
review.positiveRemarks: Very quiet And Very Clean
review.locationRemarks: It's VeryClose To All The Shops And Bars.

review.title: Superb experience all round.
review.reviewText:
The service of the front desk and the bell people was second to none, they were all friendly and informative. It was lovely seeing Maverick hold the fort at the front desk a few times we were there. The maids, room service, the fifth floor restaurant were all immaculate. The room was on the top floor and felt like a penthouse and the bathtub was so deep you could get lost in there. The only critique I have is the the WIFI charge is a little excessive, we ended up using free WIFI at the Westfield and Starbucks nearby.

I needed to see a doctor and missed my Shuttle back to the airport by minutes, they waived down a lincoln towncar in seconds and made I still made the flight.

The location is fantastic and close to shops, the Ferry Building tram and the Fishermans Wharf tram.

I would stay there again in a heartbeat.
review.positiveRemarks: Maverick, Service, and Size of room.
review.negativeRemarks: WIFI Charges/Price.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location.

review.title: Excellent hotel and location
review.reviewText: Great hotel with excellent attentive staff. The location is unbeatable (heart of the city) as it is close to all main arteries for city transportion. Great experience overall!

review.title: You'll be happy you chose the Palomar!
review.reviewText: First, we were very impressed by the friendly and welcoming staff. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk staff to the roomer cleaner went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Our room was nicely appointed with very comfortable King size bed overlooking Market Street. We could see the action but the room was soundproof. Unexpected touches like a birthday card and cupcakes left in our room made us very appreciative of the reviews that led to us choosing the Palomar. The hotel location is perfect for the range of activities that would appeal to most tourists.

review.title: Very good hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Very good hotel in an excellent location. Staff were all friendly and professional. Only issue I have is the very high charge for the valet parking = $153 for 3 days (inc tax) which is excessive.
review.positiveRemarks: location, staff, decor,
review.negativeRemarks: road noise, unless had inward facing rooms. All doors should also have slow closers to stop them slamming which is very loud.
review.locationRemarks: very good for accessing trams to the wharves,knob hill, theatre and opera district, union square for shopping

review.title: San Francisco holiday
review.reviewText: Great location for hotel away from Fishermans wharf and normal commercial tourism. Found this an advantage. Close to Union Square & shops and car hire collection. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Food and service
review.negativeRemarks: None really
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location from my perspective as away from Fishermans Wharf, but still could get cable car there if required.

review.title: Beautiful City and a great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. Great staff on hand. Could get noisy but would be going again. Only bad thing (if you call it bad) is some rooms would need some renovations.

review.title: Good find
review.reviewText: Very tastefully done. Good touches such as a complimentary cocktail hour, water at the lobby etc.. Very near restaurants and the cable car. Excellent service. Love the quirky robes.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe they could negotiate discounted parking at the 5th and Mission garage. I'm sure there can be a strong business case for justifying it.
review.locationRemarks: You can take the cable car line all the way to the Pier. Food and entertainment is a short walk away.

review.title: Discount delivered
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Palomer off the back of an Expedia 40 per cent blind discount offer. Location was great and hotel surprisingly quiet given roadworks and street entertainers. Room and hotel provided just about everything we could have wanted except maybe ability to make coffee in the room... at least if you could, we couldn't find the coffee pot to do so. Otherwise everything was great.

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText:
We arrived very late on Sunday night, and found our room had been upgraded for free, as they knew we'd just got married. The staff were always really friendly, very helpful. The rooms were clean, and our suite was so spacious..the bathroom was absolutely huge, with the biggest bath I've ever seen!!

Location-wise, this is in the most perfect spot - plenty of supermarkets just outside, a couple of doors away from Bloomingdales and all the big stores, and the ideal place to catch a bus or tram. 5 minute walk away from the tourist information centre, and cable car line. Probably around a 10-minute walk to Chinatown - in fact there is a lot to see within walking distance. But for first time visitors to SanFran, note that you can buy a $2 ticket on a bus or tram and use it on as many buses or trams as you like.

Overall, absolutely loved it!!! SanFran is an amazing city, and Hotel Palomar was the perfect place to stay :)
review.positiveRemarks: Free upgrade, tea/coffee service in the morning, huge bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, very easily accessible

review.title: OK Hotel, but overpriced.
review.reviewText: Good location. Room was very average. No major problems, but expected more for the price. Wine reception each evening and daily newspaper were nice.
review.positiveRemarks: location. wine reception.
review.negativeRemarks: Curtains need replaced.
review.locationRemarks: A couple blocks from convention center on one side and a couple blocks to Union Square the other direction.

review.title: Quirky and fun hotel with good service ethos.
review.reviewText: This is a quirky hotel, situated on top of the Old Navy store on Market and 4th Street. I liked the decor and the little touches like coffee (good coffee too) in the morning, the newspapers, the lounge area and evening wine reception, and the staff were very welcoming indeed. I had a problem with the general street noise in my original room on 4th St and the staff took pains to relocate me and I eventually got a room on the inner courtyard, which was as quiet as you could get in such a location (which is quite noisy, it must be said). Overall, I enjoyed it and would go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Touches like coffee, wine reception and friendly staff - and Maverick, the dog.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy street (Market is the worst).
review.locationRemarks: Good for shopping in particular, but a little edgy at times.

review.title: Palomar
review.reviewText:
I stayed here for almost a week in April, found the hotel a good choice since I was traveling solo for this trip. The hotel and neighbourhood both feel safe, and I did not encounter any difficulties in the surrounding areas.

If you are up for walking, you can access many of the tourist sites within 30-40 minutes. There is quick access to buses, BART, and trams on Market Street. You can take the BART straight in from the airport for $8.25, and get off at the Powell Station.

This hotel is also above a large shopping centre with pretty good stores, Nordstroms, H and M, Gap, etc. Only downside is many of the stores and restaurants in the immediate area are closed on the weekends.
review.positiveRemarks: Vibrant neighbourhood, very walkable. Hotel and neighbourhood felt safe. Hotel staff was friendly, and check-in/check-out was quick.
review.negativeRemarks: Some street noise during the day, but not too bad. Fairly well-insulated windows.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Staff very helpful pointed us in the direction of some great places to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: The reception area for am coffee and afternoon wine.
review.negativeRemarks: Sometimes a bit noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Central to many things.

review.title: awesome place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar is a great hotel, decent size clean rooms, great service from all the helpful hotel staff. It was centrally located. Easy to get to tourist spots, mission district, china town, Haight st, fisherman's wharf walking distance to union square. Safe location, well out from the tenderloin area which can get sketchy at night.
review.positiveRemarks: location, friendly service, size of rooms
review.negativeRemarks: beds were small if sleeping 4 to a room
review.locationRemarks: location is 10/10, public transport is very easy and accessible

review.title: A nice place to stay close to family

review.title: Great stay in San Fran
review.reviewText:
The staff on the front desk were helpful and our room was cleaned everyday to a high standard. Our room was comfortable/quiet and right for our needs. If traveling from New Zealand make sure you take an electric adapter conversion as they didn't have any at front desk. We used Tower Tours and found them very good and this was organised through the front desk. We dined only once at the 5th floor Restaurant. It was a dining experience with beautiful food and wine although expensive compared to NZ but it is a top star restaurant. It was our last night so we splashed out. The only down side was the amount of beggars and people sleeping rough but it was a location.
We would certainly recommend for a quality stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and tidy and although we only made it along once thought the wine tastings were good idea to meet other travelers.
review.negativeRemarks: Beggars in the same vicinity but don't think much could be done about that.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good with Westfield Mall and Bloomingdales just down the road. It was a short walk to Union Square for some sightseeing buses.

review.title: Great Location! Nice Staff!
review.reviewText:
The location of this hotel cannot be more perfect!
It is just across the street from the Powell (BART) Station, which you can catch directly to SFO (approximately $8.25US a trip per person).

The Hotel Palomar is right in the heart of the shopping distract, which is off Market Street and is also located right next to Westfield San Francisco Mall. You can easily catch the famous tram (1 block away) to Fisherman's Wharf or walk 10-15 minutes to Chinatown. It is also a block and a half from the SFMOMA.

The hotel staff were extremely helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Every evening between 5-6pm, the hotel hosts a complimentary wine tasting reception, showcasing fine wines from the Napa region.

If you stay here, try to request a room that is on a higher floor, because it is easy to hear the traffic coming from the streets.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the friendly/helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Can easily hear the noise from the streets at night.
review.locationRemarks: Central location - near the BART and municipal transit system (tram, bus, train). Within walking distance to many major San Francisco attractions.

review.title: Great weekend.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location. We were right around the corner from a muni and bart station. Shopping mall is right next store.

Dining experience not the greatest. Breakfast: toast only toasted on one side, bacon rock hard.
Breakfast potatoes could have been made the day before, cold and shriveled.
Room service: only a week ago and I can't even remember the food except for the Lemon desert tart. The Tart dropped out of a box ( old and stale), and the 4 half strawberrys "tarting up the plate" could have been prepared the day before and looked like moulded plastic.

Positive: The tea water was near to boiling.

review.title: Mother Daughter Birthday trip
review.reviewText: went for a birthday trip with my mom and my sister. Service was fantastic - hotel staff provided nice suprises upon our arrival for our birthdays - a nice bottle of champagne, flowers and chocolates! All staff were great with providing directions and suggestions. Location is fantastic - steps away from the BART, F-line and cable cars. WIthin blocks of excellent shopping and restaurants. Room was exceptionally clean and beds were comfortable. nice to have the flavoured water to return to after a day of exploring the city. I am starting to plan my next trip back already. The only drawback was when we ate breakfast in the restaurant, there was a ridiculous amount of oil in my omlette - I only ate a few bites. Save your money and eat somewhere else where the food and prices are way better.

review.title: Hotel still good but has to get back to normal
review.reviewText:
After having checked out different other hotels in San Francisco (some too conservative, some too modern, some too expensive, some too touristy) I really like this hotel in general. The staff and ambience is nice. Great central location. What I always miss is water free of charge in the rooms which has become in 4/5-Star-Hotels a standard. They have water in the lobby though.
This time I needed to print something and found only one 'station' in the so-called business center but you have free Wifi everywhere when registered.
This time I also got bothered by construction noise very early in the morning which was not announced.
The breakfast was just o.k. Having a top restaurant in the house I expected way more. The breakfast service was every single day extremely slow. Room service was also slow and the food quality didn't live to standard.
Therefore, you will be fine if you don't need any of the services.
Tips: I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families with children. Avoid rooms with Market street view if you like it more quiet. Some rooms can be dark though.
review.positiveRemarks: Wine reception, coffee in the morning - free of charge
review.negativeRemarks: Small lobby
review.locationRemarks: Very close to public transportation and taxis line up in front of hotel. You can walk to cable car also.

review.title: Disappointing experience
review.reviewText: Disappointing experience. Having checked in late in the evening after a six-hour flight, I got one of the worst rooms in house. It was close to the restaurant, and the loud company of people continued making noise well past midnight. Worse yet, loud banging started at 6am and continued through the morning. Front desk advised me that there was construction work going on at the retailer below. Banging was so loud, it was difficult to hear the person on the phone. Frustratingly, nobody at check-out asked me about my stay or offered any consolation for the disturbance.

review.title: Excellent Experience
review.reviewText:
Amenities
From the time the shuttle dropped me at the hotel to the time it picked me up again 4 days later I felt like I was at home. The staff were friendly and always helpful. My room was perfectly clean, modern and the bed and bathroom facilities were excellent.

Location
The most important aspect for me though was the location - perfectly located adjacent to the Market st and Union Square shopping area, yet still completely quiet. I didn't hear any sirens or street noise at all. There are several trolley car station in Market St providing cheap transport down to the bay.

Activities
I caught a trolley car down to the wharf where I rented a bicycle and rode across the Golden Gate bridge to Sausalito and Tiburon, then caught the ferry back to the wharf. Great day out. I also visited Alcatraz (via trolley car from the hotel) and Yosemite NP - picked up from the hotel.

Highly recommended. I will definitely stay here again when in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: The only areas of the city I visited in any 'depth' on my short stay was Market Street, Union Square, and Fishermans Wharf. All worth a look. I also enjoyed a bike ride through Sausalito and Tiburon, which gave me the opportunity to chat with local residents - albeit in some of the more well-to-do areas!

review.title: excellent choice
review.reviewText:
The Palomar is an excellent hotel in an extremely convenient location. we arrived by plane and could easily move our big suitcases to the hotel via the BART. All staffs at the hotel were helpful and friendly. The wine reception in the evening was really nice and we found the hotel host to be interesting and enjoyable to have a chat with. The level 5 area was very relaxing.
Liked the coffee and tea availability on level 5 in the morning and the all day water on the ground floor. Great touch. Having tea and coffee available later in the evening would be a great addition.
Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone looking to stay in downtown SF.

review.title: Modernity with cleanliness
review.reviewText: Very fun hotel with wine happy hour every afternoon, a goldfish in your room to keep you company and a bottle of wine to keep you warm. Lovely stay, with clean linens and a great location next to the Moscone Convention Center and a swank little mall. A little seedier a few blocks down once night falls, but just be a wary traveler. Delicious food (San Franciscan perk, really) and fun stores all around. The room was so comfortable and cozy that we opted to stay in for the evening and stay warm instead of walking too much outside. Bathroom is small and modest, but the banging shower head makes up for everything. No coffee maker in your room, but just go to the fifth floor lobby and you'll have a great cup to start your day.

review.title: How sad: the doorman
review.reviewText:
When we arrived at the hotel, the doorman wished to know whether we required help with our baggage. This was a sure request for a tip if he so much as touched the bags. Had he been better trained or supervised, he would have offered to take the bags out of the cab, or reached for them with a comment such as: "Let me help".

Needless to say, I handled the bags myself, and he received not itp.

Hotel was excellent other than this individual, who appeared to engage in conversation on other occassions rather than attending the door.
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square--center, vibrant, restaurants
South of Market--museums, conferences, restaurants

review.title: Excellent location, small rooms/bath, robes but no slippers, but happy hour, coffee & business cente
review.reviewText:
Excellent locale around the corner from BART to go to Berkeley, and from the cable car that takes you down to Fisherman's Wharf. ALso right across the street from the Apple store and around the corner from a shopping mall.

ROoms are small, not as nice as the LA Palomar, but service was excellent, better than LA Palomar. Wine happy hour everyday at 5 was a pleasure, and there was always free coffee at same spot in the morning.

Cool leopard and zebra bathrobes, but no slippers: (

Very helpful and friendly front desk staff and bellboys. GIve yourself 10 extra minutes to find a cab. Lunch at the Grove up MIssion in the safe direction.
review.locationRemarks: FIsherman's Wharf and Pier 39,

review.title: Comfort Plus
review.reviewText: Great location with excellent comfort. Friendly staff. Definitely recommended.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. However the AC didnâ€™t have an automatic mode for controlling the temperature and air flow, so I had to turn it off after awhile since it was quite noisy.

review.title: Perfect location for a perfect night!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for a night to see the city. This hotel is wonderful, in a great area near everything, and the staff was amazing. We unfortunately had to switch to a different hotel because of my wife's work meeting she had to attend but if we ever come back to San Francisco we will definitely stay here again. It was quiet and very comfortable and you can walk to anything in the city. The BART station was right outside the door, so it was very easy traveling from the airport. I cannot say anything bad about this hotel. It is well worth the money and not much more expensive than other hotels. We absolutely loved it.

review.title: Not a bad hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, pretty close to union square. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Outstanding hotel!
review.reviewText: We were extremely pleased with our stay at the Palomar. It's in a great location for sightseeing and going out in San Francisco, and it was an easy to walk to stores and restaurants. There is a BART stop right around the corner as well. The room was clean and modern, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on! We liked the extras, like cucumber water in the lobby, free newspapers and the lounge on the 5th floor. I also used the fitness room, which has nice equipment, towels and a cold water dispenser. This hotel will be our first choice if we vacation in SF again.

review.title: Great Location !
review.reviewText: Great location- walking distance to many things; Bart stop / cable Car and Street Car all within walking distance. Close to a great shopping mecca. Very friendly and helpful conceige ( Lauren- was the best !! )

review.title: A Great Location
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Palomar for 3 nights during the San Francisco portion of our trip. It was very convenient to the Powell Street BART station (just a little over a block away), cable cars, museums, etc. This is a very crowded area and not sure that I would personally choose this again, but if you want convenience, this hotel can't be beat. Maverick the Hospital Dog was at the doggie spa during our stay, so we did not get to meet him. We got a great last-minute deal on Expedia, well below other hotels in the area. The room itself was small, but nice.

review.title: Fantastic hotel experience at the Palomar!
review.reviewText: Palomar Hotel was absolutely central to every single thing we wanted to see in San Francisco. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the room was huge and gorgeous, and the staff were genuine and utterly professional. We were beyond impressed, and as this was our first stay at a Kimpton hotel, it impressed us enough that we'll seek out Kimpton hotels from now on. I want to go back!

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel was definitely nice overall, but on second stay would request a room facing the outside - the ones facing the inner "courtyard" meant not opening the windows unless you want to stare at other people's rooms, or down into Old Navy. I think the life on the street-side would have been worth wearing earplugs at night. Oh yeah, and - request not to be next to an ice machine.
The location was great for public transport and very safe, but if you are looking for more "unique" San fran, don't stay here, its surrounded by big-box stores that are in every decent sized city.
I was unimpressed that despite the free bike rental, all the bikes were the same size - I'm a fit 5'2" adult and couldn't use the bikes because they were too big.
Also - concierge seemed to know what was going on when I said I was considering going to a show, but surely it wouldn't be too hard for the hotel to get some sort of binder or list of times, locations, etc., so you can browse at leisure.
To sum up - all my complaints are relatively unimportant/only relevant in some cases - the room was great, and staff very nice, so overall would def recommend the place!

review.title: Incredible Location
review.reviewText:
Hotel Palomar was a wonderful hotel. Getting there from the airport was easy, with a BART station right around the corner. It has easy access to cable and street cars, and an F line stop is right out front to take you to Fisherman's Wharf, or the ferry building for tours of Napa/Sonoma. The location is next to none. It's a quick walk to/along Market Street, Union Square, SMOMA, and the Westfield shopping centre essentially being next door makes for ease and convenience. It's close to great dining and bars and has several pharmacies nearby should the need arise.

The staff were outgoing and personable and did everything they could to make our stay more comfortable. The complimentary flavoured water available in the lobby at all times, wine tasting hour, and Maverick the rescue dog all helped to enhance our stay. The rooms were small, but clean, comfortable and quiet. Easy controls for television and air conditioning and housekeeping was timely, efficient and accommodating.

I wouldn't stay anywhere else should I return to San Francisco. They couldn't have done anything more. Fantastic hotel, amazing staff, and ideal location.

review.title: First time in the area and enjoyed
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the morning coffee in lobby and afternoon lemonade. We also participated in the Wine Social Evening which was fun. Thanks

review.title: Great Weekend!
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a Great weekend. The hotel was very nice and convienently located. We really enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting happy hour and our dinner in the restaurant was excellent!

review.title: San Fran Palamar
review.reviewText: The staff was exceptional and personable. They answered every question and sent us on the right path to our destination every time we went out. I am very pleased that we did not rent a car and used the public transportation. Parking is 40.00 a night so it not worth that. We figured out the bus and bart system quickly and were able to go everywhere we desired. It was a great place to stay and would stay there again if we go back. I would advise you to take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper because this is an older hotel and not well insulated from interior noise. We heard no noise from the streets.

review.title: Hope to Return
review.reviewText: Quiet, unobtrusive. Almost like having an apartment. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, perfect location in central San Francisco, free wine/sangria every evening, quiet, clean and comfortable, highly recommend!!

review.title: Great SF boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, different from the usual chains. The only problem was that their breakfast restaurant opens at 7. I wish it would open earlier in the morning.

review.title: great location with friendly staff
review.reviewText: staff at this hotel were absolutely charming and professional, including "maverick", the chocolate lab rescue dog that hangs out in the front lobby. the first room that we checked into smelled like there was a plumbing issue, and we were immediately given another room upon our complaint about the foul odor. the room ( a king deluxe) was clean and the bed was comfortable, but best of all it smelled fantastic! the location (4th and market st) was convenient for our trip. we took the BART from SFO ($8.10/ one way ticket) and it dropped us off less than 2 min. walk from the hotel lobby. we also were able to walk to AT&T park to catch the game (giants/ dodgers) in approx 20 mins. cable car turnaround point is less than 5 minute walk from hotel. we also took advantage of the use of some fine dutch made bicycles that are for the use of hotel guests. they come with helmets, and locks, and you can use them until sundown! (free..first come first served) and took a ride down to fisherman's wharf (approx 25 mins cruising slowly and avoiding the traffic...kind of scary, but fun!) complimentary coffee, iced coffee, and tea on the 5th floor every morning from 6-10, and wine or sangria from 5-6pm. we had a great time staying at the hotelpalomar, and will most likely choose it again.

review.title: Excellent location - would strongly recommend
review.reviewText: Really good location right next to mall and shops - 2 blocks from union square - excellent hotel staff - all in all really good!Strongly recommend.

review.title: Highly recommend to anyone visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The Palomar hotel is one of the nicest we have stayed in in a long time. The location is supurb for shopping and dining. It is centrally located to cable cars and china town.
The staff is fantastic, We were greeted with hello's and smiles everytime we entered or left the hotel. The doormen were great and the concierge was very helpfull. There was no coffee pot in the room so upon request they brought one up for us to use during our stay. If you ask them for something they are very very accommodating. We are recommending this hotel to our doughter for her stay in San Francisco and anyone else who is visiting.
A++++++++

review.title: Right where you want to be
review.reviewText: great location for shopping, right by the trasit system (Bart) which will get you to and from the airport.

review.title: Will go there again!!!!!!
review.reviewText:
The staff was fantastic!!!!!!!!! It felt like everyone was there just for me. The Hotel was Fantastic!!!!!! I will stay here again if I come here again.
The coffee bar in the lounge every morning was great, the wine bar in the evening was great and the flavored water through out the day in the lobby was great. The room was very comfortable and did not hear any noise. The bathrobes were a nice touch. I have no complaints. Very close to Muni(transit system) to take you to the Pier or to Castro. If you are there for 3 days I suggest get the 3 day pass and you can ride unlimited, a lot cheaper. Very close to Museums, shopping and many restraunts. Umbrella in the room to use was a nice touch.

review.title: Hard to Decide which to Stay at Next: Palomar of Monoco
review.reviewText:
We loved the convenience to BART, shopping, the museums, and everything else. All of our questions were answered by the helpful staff.

The bathroom had no fan or spray. The door opening was three feet from the bed, so there was no way to eliminate bathroom smells going into the room.

No vegetarian choice on room service. Vegetarian tasting menu not available as advertised in the dining room.

review.title: Good value at Expedia price
review.reviewText:
The big negative for this property is the location - it is located close to the SF Centre, but the element loitering around Market Street is very undesirable.

The hotel itself is fine - rooms are nice, very clean, but basic. A nice wine offering in the afternoon. I would only stay again if I scored the bargain I obtained through Expedia - the prices listed on the hotel website are inconsistent with the value.

This wasn't an issue for me, but there is only one restaurant on property and it isn't open on Sunday's. Again, not a problem due to all the other dining options around the city.

review.title: Great hotel, very central
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable and nice hotel within 5 mins walking distance to Union Square. Froont desk staff were extremely friendly and recommended a great mexican restaurant nearby.
For authentic american diner breakfast experience go to Lori's diner...... Also recommend checking out Biscuit and Blues for late night music ....

review.title: Hotel Palomar-Fantastic Hotel!
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend Hotel Palomar. The hotel is clean, comfortable and quiet despite the central location of it being right in the heart of San Francisco. The location is walking distance to dining, dancing and shopping. I would definitely stay at Hotel Palomar again. The Palomar team treated me with such courtesy and kindness...just very accommodating. Great job Palomar team!

review.title: Union Square Gem
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar was an excellent find. It's quiet and luxurious. The staff is attentive and helpful. The wine happy hour was a pleasant surprise with two very good wine choices. The bar and restaurant were very good and had lots of ambience. They truely seem to try hard to provide an excellent customer experience....complete with a full coffee and tea bar each morning. The location was also outstanding!!

review.title: Perfect if travelling alone
review.reviewText: Great location, very efficient service, comfortable enough rooms, free internet, great bedding. Standard and deluxed rooms are rather small though. The walls, too, are very thin - so you can hear your neighbours and everybody outside your door (which can be annoying)... But if the hotel is just for sleeping, it's totally perfect. If you plan to spend a bit of time there, I'd consider other options. Fine for a business traveller.

review.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the quaintness of this small hotel. Such a nice refuge in the middle of the hustling city. Highly recommend it those attending an event/conference at the Moscone Center. Great location, but more quiet and private than the big Marriott across the street.

review.title: Will definately book to stay in a Kimpton hotel again!
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel. The daily wine reception was a fantastic touch.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText:
This is a nice boutique hotel in the heart of SF. The staff is friendly, the decor is stylish and it is close to everything!
The rooms are pretty small and the big soaking tub isn't worth the extra expense, especially if you're only there a short time.
Great wine reception and the lounge/restaurant has a great atmosphere.

review.title: Nice and Neat with some minor misshaps!
review.reviewText:
Majority of the experience was great at Hotet Palomar. The staff are a little reserved but I guess Im used to Australian friendliness and laid back culture.
The cleanliness was up to my expectations and I guess it meets 4 star quality.
The only thing that I was very upset about was the fact that the hotel made charges for an umbrella, socks and mini bar items that were not used so I had been charged on my credit card without being notified first.
I rang the hotel and got them to credit most of these items back however I had missed out on the full amount as I am Australian so the conversion changed and my bank charged me large fees.
Apart from this Morgan was the nicest staff member so say hi to her if you stay here!

review.title: Stylish, excellent location
review.reviewText:
We chose Hotel Palomar because of its location, which was even more convenient than originally expected. With a MUNI and BART station just around the corner, and plenty of bus and streetcar lines practically outside the door, the hotel is perfectly situated to get to anywhere within SF, whether by public transit or foot. Surrounded by shopping and Union Square is a few block away. The hotel itself is stylish yet simple, with friendly and helpful staff. We didn't check out the wine reception, but we frequently drank the complimentary fruit-infused water from the coolers by the lobby elevator; it was a nice refreshing touch. Our room (Deluxe King), while not large, had a big closet and enough storage space for clothes and luggage. It was clean when we checked in, and the bed/linens were in good shape and comfortable. I suppose our biggest complaint is that the towels could have been less worn and more plush, but that's somewhat minor. Our room was an interior one, with a view of the Old Navy roof, so we don't have any comments about street noise.

Anyways, the hotel has a great, central location and our room/bed was comfortable. It suited our needs just fine, and we plan on staying there again when we return to SF.

review.title: San Francisco Palomar is Great
review.reviewText:
My experience at the Palomar was extremely satisfactory.
Everything was within reach of the hotel and the condition of the hotel and the staff were phenomenal.

review.title: Pet-friendly hotel; Great location
review.reviewText: will stay at this hotel again ... great location in union square ... hotel helps to promote pet adoption ... friendly staff ...

review.title: San Francisco's Hotel Palomar
review.reviewText: The Hotel was a lot smaller than I had anticipated, but so nicely located that you tend to forget about the size. The lobby was minuscule. The room had a great view, a nice tub but was such a disappointment in terms of size. We purposefully spent a lot more money for the Luxury room and were really surprised that all this entailed was a few perks (awesome tub and view). I was tempted to ask what the two room choices below ours look like, if this was "luxury". The 5th floor we were on was great, it had the gym, business centre and lounge (where coffee, wine are served at specific times of day). The restaurant would have been nicer if it were less gourmet, and less expensive... that said, my "reasonable" and someone else's "reasonable could be different. The Business Centre was very costly to use and therefore we didn't couldn't make use of the printer. Internet is free- in your room, not in the business centre...oddly. Over all a nice place, pricey, but nice. I think we were just out of sorts there.

review.title: Nice small hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly, helpful staff. Will definitely consider staying here again.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Great dog friendly hotel, even if we didn't bring ours.

review.title: Hidden Gem in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Kimpton continues to impress me. This hotel is in an older building right off Market. They've done a nice job rehabbing the rooms, and we looked out to an inner courtyard so it was nice and quiet. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My only complaint was not having coffee makers in the room. It was a bit of a pain to go down to the 5th floor--after getting dressed--to get my morning coffee. That said, I thought the location--about a block and half off of Union Square--was great. We were able to take BART in from the airport and it was an easy walk to the hotel. We enjoyed ourselves very much and will definitely return.

review.title: I would go back at another time.
review.reviewText:
Everything was just fine except for the fact that the pillows were not great.

the bedding pillows were dirty.....spots

should use plastic glasses in the bathroom and shower cap and etc should be replaced when used.

no plastic laundry bags in closet.

review.title: Great Hotel Overall
review.reviewText:
This is a terrific hotel, for the most part. However, we were apparently given the wrong room at check-in. We stayed in this room for an entire day, and then another guest was given a key to the same room and barged in on us! Then, the front desk called and told us we had to move. They didn't offer to send a bellhop to help us or comp our room. We were just told that they "would take care of us", which meant that we would get a free drink in the bar that night for our trouble.

We felt like second class citizens and a free drink doesn't really negate the fact that their mistake was embarrassing and inconvenient for us.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, you`re close to everything. Outstanding hotel from service to cleaniness. Staff was helpful and courteous. Would definetly stay again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: If it had a view, it would have been nearly perfect.
review.reviewText:
The staff at the front desk was very accomodating and helpful with suggestions of things to do and see and in giving directions.
Everyone was very friendly and courteous. Easy walking distance to food and shopping. Parking was expensive per day plus add'l tax on parking.

review.title: Best bet when staying "just off" Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient! It sits right on Market and is next door to the mall. Only a block or two will have you at Union Square and all the shopping is close by. This is my second time and I think I've found my base when visiting SF.

review.title: Great location makes up for small rooms
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my 1-night stay at the Palomar. Room ready early so I was very pleased. Easy in/out valet service. Rooms are small but nicely decorated (pocket, sliding doors for the bathroom). Great location near Union Square & BART station. Free wireless internet a plus!

review.title: EXCELLENT!
review.reviewText: You will not be disapointed with your stay. Excellent location and very helpful staff.

review.title: Comforting and safe
review.reviewText:
Good for business and leisure alike because of central location. All public transportation is close by; taxis across the street.
You should ask for room to the courtyard and might like to book the Executive rooms if you are in SF for business.
On 5th and 6th floor you might hear some music noise as they have Conference rooms rented out for parties but those usually ended at 10.30PM latest.
Nice are the wine receptions in case you are in the hotel at that time of the day.

review.title: Overall a good stay
review.reviewText: The staff at the Hotel Palomar were excellent - they were friendly and very helpful. The location of the hotel is very convenient - close to the Powell station for the BART and the Muni system, plus a close walk to everything. Our first room was quite small, but was clean and comfortable. While we had booked a king room, we really needed 2 beds. The hotel was sold out of double rooms, so they were great in moving us to a larger room and comping us a roll away cot. The hotel was very quiet - which is surprising for a down town hotel. The windows don't open, but the HVAC works well, so the room wasn't stuffy. The cost for the room was quite high compared with similar hotels in other major cities we've travelled to, but it was in the middle of high season.

review.title: Convenient Market Street Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was just as expected, very comfortable, with good sized rooms and bathroom, comfortable beds and linens, in room wi-fi. Very convenient location on Market Street. Bart station, bus lines, cable car all within short walk. Two blocks to Union Square, a short walk to theaters and a short ride to Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf. Slightly longer bus ride to Golden Gate Park with the DeYoung Museum, the Japanese Tea Garden and the Science Center. The hotel location really helped us get the most out of our short 3 1/2 day mother and daughter getaway.

review.title: Absolutely the best!!
review.reviewText: Very pleased with everything. The room, the service, any questions, Lauren even gave me her number if I had difficulty getting in touch with my family in the Bay Area, which was the reason I was in the area. I can't say say enough about how great everyone was!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel with great location.

review.title: Centrally located for shopping and entertainment
review.reviewText: This is a beautifully maintained relatively small hotel right in the center of downtown shopping and near MOMA. The entrance is difficult to see near a VERY busy intersection with heavy traffic. Once there, though, everything went very smoothly. I will return

review.title: worth the money... very nice option
review.reviewText: OVer all it was a very nice experience

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel really surpassed my expectations. It was nice on the inside, the restaurant food was tasty, they passed out free drinks at the bar during happy hour and the staff was friendly and accomodating. The only drawback to this hotel was that my cell phone did not get service in my room which proved fustrating but supposedly this is an ordeal throughout the city - not just at this hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms are very comfortable. Service is very curtious and fast. The morning coffee is on the 5th floor, and is great. The fitness room is small, but adequate. the nightly wine reception is a great bonus, though we only got to experience it one night of our stay, since the window of "opportunity " is limited to one hour.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: really nice hotel. with an online discount the price was fair. perfect location.

review.title: A great modern boutique experience near Union Square
review.reviewText: Kimpton Hotels almost always hit the mark, and the Palomar Hotel was a typical great experience. Liek almost all Kimptons, it offers a modern boutique hotel inside a beautiful refurbished exterior. Good service and a refreshing break from the chain-hotel experience.

review.title: Great place to stay for events and the Moscone Center
review.reviewText:
We arrived at the hotel and were greeted like we VIP's. The doors were always opened for us as we approached the entrance from either inside or outside. The front desk staff always had friendly words for us as we passed and were very helpful when we asked for directions or suggestions for meals and other destinations.

Our room was larger then expected, very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Convenient and comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, friendly staff, covenient location & the hotel restaurant supplied good breakfast choices.

review.title: Don't stay here if you're use to the corporate hotels...
review.reviewText: I'm a business traveler and I really appreciated this hotel for its cleanliness and convenience to everything in the city. The downside to this hotel (or any boutique hotel for that matter) is that there are mainly vacationers staying there. When I'm on the road, i like to eat dinner at the bar and have the prospect to hang out and chat it up with other business travelers. Not here, the bar/ restaurant area was pretty much dead both nights I was there. To be fair, it was mid-week.

review.title: Best Boutique Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Right in the heart of downtown. Valet parking was well worth it. BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!! The front desk clerk, Lauren was the most knowledgeable and helpful hotel personel I have ever met. Her professionalism and pride in her job translated into her being able to recommend interesting parts of San Francisco to visit with wonderful restaraunts and shopping. She also ensured that our room what exactly what I had reserved and it was even ready early. She helped make our mother/daughter get-away so much more special.

review.title: Ideal base for what the City has to offer
review.reviewText: Concierge and staff with charm, not smarm. Room capacious, bed beyond comfortable, and blissfully undisturbed by the city traffic seven floors below. Anchored between the Financial District, and the opulent shops of Union Square, with a fine selection of proximate restaurants thrown in. No hesitation in recommending it unreservedly.

review.title: Crusty Check-in Experience but Nice After That.
review.reviewText: We got off to a bad start. Arrived way before check in at 10am on 2/24, sick and very tired, and one deskclerk told us coldly that a room would not be ready until 3:00pm, which we found out was the worst case scenario when we were told later it should be ready by 1. Clearly the first clerk wanted us to go away and not bother her for a while. The second one was nicer. Everything was basically ok, but few nice touches, and no coffee makers in room, so you have to get showered and dressed to get coffee and carry it back to your room. Room was small but nice, and the location was good for walking around SF; design was elegant throughout the hotel, beds and sheets were great, and staff was fine after the first morning.

review.title: Can't wait NOT to come back!
review.reviewText:
Very disappointed!!

Concierge service did not follow through with our request for information about local museum.

Bathtub drains VERY SLOWLY. Standing in about 4" of water throughout the shower. Called front desk and issue was supoosed to be taken care of while we were out....no such luck.

Vent in bathroom does not work. Thermostat for heating/cooling has a button that gets stuck. It will somethimes turn the heat on and then turn the cooling on without anyone touching it!!

Overall, a disappointing experience for what is supposed to be a highly rated hotel.

The bed was comfortable....at least.

review.title: The Palomar
review.reviewText: If only the Kimpton had a whirlpool bath and a free continental breakfast, this hotel would be perfect. For those in San Francisco for the Moscone Center, this hotel is perfectly situated.

review.title: Hotel Palomar - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall, hotel ammenities and location excellent. We were extremely pleased with our weekend getaway until we discovered we forgot our set of keys in the room. I immediately called the Palomar reception desk when we landed and was happy/relieved to learn that housekeeping found/turned in the set of keys. The front desk took my mailing information for overnight FedEx delivery, but unfortunately, the package had the wrong address written on the form and it took 4 days to track and get our keys. FedEx blaimed Palomar and vice versa. As a Kimpton member and repeat guest, I'd think my contact (ie, mailing address) information would be available to staff for verification. I take responsibility for our error, but was disappointed and upset that the address was written incorrectly causing home and work hardship.

review.title: Great area for shipping and dining
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Plenty of coffee and newpapers in the morning, and a nice wine reception at 5:00.
Room had a nice view of Market St., but the traffic could be heard thoughout the night..

review.title: Great Hotel for moderate price
review.reviewText: The palomar was located just a few steps from the BART station on Market Street, a short walk to Union Square, the Powell Street Streetcar and a couple of blocks from the Moscone Center where my conference was. The hotel was clean, comfortable and well appointed. I would stay there again.

review.title: Excellent SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel Choice for SF

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location, great service, and the comfort of the room was terrific.

review.title: Fien hotel, you can't go wrong
review.reviewText: Perfect location from MUNI to see sights, restaurant, movies, etc. 5th time staying there and will definitely stay again

review.title: Amazing Experience for Anniversary!
review.reviewText:
I booked my parents a hotel room here for the weekend for their 40th wedding anniversary. I had notified the hotel that it was a special day for them and was hoping they would provide them with a nice room with a view of union square. I had no idea that the staff at this hotel would be so unbelieveably exceptional! My parents called me from San Francisco to let me know that the staff had upgraded them to a Suite and it was so lovely! They later went and participated in the wine tasting in the lobby (one of the things I love about Kimptons) and when they got back to their room the front desk had left champagne and strawberries in their room for them!

My parents must have called me five times on thier two day trip to tell me how pleased they were with their hotel experience, everything from how they slept, to the friendliness of the staff, to the fantastic location right on Union Square. I had to tell them to stop calling to tell me how great it is and to simply go enjoy it!

Considering there are hundreds of hotels in San Francisco, I am very happy to have discovered this gem in the heart of this bustling city. I would book another room here without hesitation. If you are looking for a hotel that provides exceptional service, total comfort and a fantastic location, look no further than Hotel Palomar!

review.title: Cozy hotel in great location!
review.reviewText: If you're coming to San Francisco to be in the middle of everything or for a convention, then this is a great hotel! It's on the corner of Market and 4th. A block and a half away from the Moscone Center. It's in the heart of all the shopping -- just a couple of blocks away from Union Square. The bus stops just outside the front door, and there is a subway stop around the corner. And, you can catch a true cable car from just a couple of blocks away, too. There are several restaurants nearby - Mel's Diner, and indian restaurant, and a bakery are just steps away. The room was very clean and quiet and kinda modern/trendy. Flat screen, big TV, etc. And, the hotel does have it's own restaurant on the 5th floor. And, two movie theatres are less than a block away, too! Loved this location!

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Courteous and attentive staff on duty at the front desk. Surprisingly quiet room considering hotel's location on super busy Market St. (double-sealed insulated windows). MUNI, BART, and F-line historic streetcar quite literally stop at the front door. Cable Car one block away.

review.title: Beautiful, clean and well serviced boutique hotel in the center of downtown San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The subject title says it all! Look up Hotel Palomar and book a room there. You will be pleased.

review.title: LGBT friendly
review.reviewText: Hello, I am a professional drag king who recently visited SF for a performance. I stayed three nights at the SF Palomar and felt very welcomed and comfortable there. Of course, when I walked into the front lobby one night in drag, I was stopped by the doorman and asked to show my identification. When I flashed my female driver's license to the front desk person, she didn't raise an eyebrow. That often is not the case for me, in spite of the level of quality hotels that I choose. A special thanks to the concierge staff members, D.C. and Jake.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We were very happy with this hotel. We were close to everything. Public transportation was right outside the door, and everything was within walking distance. Lots of shopping right around the corner. The service was wonderful. our room was cleaned in a timely manner, and the decor was very impressive. The restaurant was very expensive for breakfast. We would stay there again

review.title: Can't wait to return to Hotel Palomar.
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar exceeded all expectations! Everything was great. Staff knew where to advise on great food, directions, and were willing to help with anything at all. We celebrated our one year wedding anniversary in SF and the people of SF and staff at Palomar made it great. We can't wait to come back!

review.title: I would go back
