review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Close to tons of shopping and has easy access to BART, train cars, buses, cable cars. Other than a dirty duvet cover which they were quick to replace, our experience was very good. The staff gave us good recommendations on restaurants, provided maps so we could find our way and gave us other insight into tourist spots.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: As a regular traveler to SF, I stayed in the Palomar for leisure and loved it. It's in the heart of the shopping district and public transportation to anywhere (including the Cable Cars) is easily accessible from the front door. The restaurant "The Fifth Floor" was truly an excellent dining experience. The desk staff and concierge was friendly and most helpful. The room was posh, the mattress was PERFECT. The only drawback was that the thermostat in the room was difficult to adjust. I'll stay here again.

review.title: Perfect location, clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: I can't fault this hotel. It was clean, convenient, comfortable and modern. I'd recommend it to anyone who loves shopping, theatre and food!

review.title: Perfect place to relax and feel special
review.reviewText: After reading tons of positive things about the hotel on trip advisor, we booked the hotel for 5 nights and we weren't disappointed. The hotel was wonderful--a boutique hotel that didn't feel too small but yet had personal touches that made it special. Rooms were modern and funky and clean and comfortable. The service was incredibly personalized. For the first time ever, I got a handwriten note from our room maid thanking us for the tips we left her. The doormen were friendly and helpful with advice on where to eat and how to get places and the 5th floor restaurant was delicious. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and they made it an experience to remember--comping us a anniversary drink and having all their staff wish us a happy anniversary on our way out. Highly recommend the Palomar and would stay there again if we went back to San Fran. P.S. It's also right in the middle of everything and only a block from one of the BART stations so you can easily get from the airport to hotel using BART rather than paying for a taxi.

review.title: Lovely
review.reviewText: Great staff, courteous service, clean hotel, free wine for an hour daily : )

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: I can't say enough about this place. The staff, the accommodations, the location which gives you easy access to a variety of public transit. (You can even take BART from SFO to Powell Street and you are about half a block from the hotel.) Now I once lived in San Francicso, so I knew that the Market Street area around 4th is not exactly picturesque. (But the trade-off is quick access to BART, Muni, the cable car, and a large shopping mall with a food market in the basement.) And I also knew the Hotel Palomar was built on top of a store, which means there is no grand lobby. But none of that mattered. I was treated wonderfully by the friendly and courteous staff. All you need is a smile and they return it many times. When a light bulb popped, there was someone there literally in minutes to fix it. I would stay there again any time. In fact, I wish I could go back next week!

review.title: awesome stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar for three nights and could not have been more pleased. We traveled to the hotel on the BART and the station stop is only a block away which saved us a lot of money. We had called ahead to see if they would store our bags until check-in time (answer yes) however they had our room available upon arrival. Clean room, wonderfully soft bed, awesome view from the 9th floor, made our trip a wonderful experience!

review.title: A great choice
review.reviewText: Right in the heart of downtown San Francisco this hotel is a great choice to stay. The room was really good (although we didn't spend much time in it) all the big shops and Union Square are a short walk away. We didn't eat in the hotel (too expensive) but diners are nearby and they are good value. The staff were really helpful and were always willing to explain stuff to us. The room always looked immaculate when we returned. A slight niggle for us Brits - there are no tea making facilities in the room. However, in the morning 7-9 there is tea and coffee available on the 5th floor free. Really can't fault it. The killer question - would I stay there again? No problem with that one, yes, certainly.

review.title: good overall
review.reviewText: i choose this hotel because of its closeness to the convention center. it served us well. for a 4-star rating i expected a little more plush and there's no lobby!! but the hotel was overall a good choice

review.title: Great Place in Great Location.
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed there during 4th of July weekend and it was a very nice place. Clean rooms, great downtown location just steps from the Powell Bart station which saved us money by not paying for a cab. We asked for a fan for our room because we like the noise when sleeping and they brought one up minutes later. I also left some shirts in the closet on accident and they mailed them back to me. I paid the postage but I thought that was nice of them to take care of it with no issue.

review.title: Best SF Hotel!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I headed to San Francisco over the 4th of July and chose to stay at the Hotel Palomar based on reviews of others. It was an excellent choice! The staff, service and rooms were great! Everyone was so nice and accommodating -- upon check-in, Keta gave us a map of SF and gave us some advice on good places to visit and how to get there. DC was an excellent concierge and was friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend this place!

review.title: Great location and service.
review.reviewText: This hotel is extremely well located. Friendly staff and great wine/ice cream happy hours.

review.title: wonderful hotel great location
review.reviewText: A wonderful small hotel in the heart of the city. Staff is friendly and professional. Restaurant is great.

review.title: Where to Stay for WWDC
review.reviewText: We had not been to San Francisco before so choosing our hotel was purely by chance. I needed something close for walking to the convention center... it was two blocks away! Cable cars of buses were also available literally right out the front door of the hotel. Our room was very nice. With all new upgraded flat panel TV and free Wi-Fi in our rooms. A king size bed that was better than our's at home. Being on the seventh floor gave us a great view of the busy streets below. The staff was extremely helpful and polite with all our questions. I'm sure there was a friendship made during our stay. We will be back next year for the WWDC and we will most likely be staying here again.

review.title: Very Nice but .....
review.reviewText: As far as the hotel goes, it was a very nice and well kept hotel. The service was very friendly. The only complaint that I have about this hotel is that the website said that parking was $42. When I arrived I found out it's $45 and not for the whole stay but $45/day. They did resolve the issue by giving us a 20% discount on the parking but that is still way more than the $42 I was expecting to pay. I understand that this is a downtown hotel so everything that I needed to get to was in walking distance but I'm from the east coast so while I was there, I wanted to explore a little more than what's walking or mass transit distance away. I would have never rented a car if I knew it was going to be that much.

review.title: I want to live there
review.reviewText: I could not wait to get home to write this review. I will never, stay in another hotel in SF. The Palomar is above Old Navy at the corner of Powell & Market. The BART/muni Powell street exit is just around the corner from the entrance to the hotel. The room is small and minimalist in its furnishing but clean and stylish. The bed was amazing, we actually pulled the sheets off in the morning to write down the brand/style of the mattress. The pillows and comforter were great too -- even the toiletries were great. We arrived around noon and thought we'd just ask to store our luggage until check-in at 3pm, but they gave us a room and when we checked out they offered to hold our bags as long as we needed. The hotel was as quiet as it could be for the city, I personally have never understood people who complain about street noise when they stay in a hotel in Union Square -- for me that's part of the travel experience. We had an inward facing room but could still hear the street and wasn't bothered at all by it. The hotel itself was silent. The hotel probably isn't "kid friendly" in the sense that there isn't anything for kids to do there at the hotel, but I wouldn't hesitate staying at the hotel with my children -- who goes to SF to play in a hotel anyway?

review.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Yes, this is an excellent boutique hotel.

review.title: Great deal, convenient location
review.reviewText: I recently stayed here - the location was very convenient to the BART (getting to and from the airport was a breeze). The room I had was large and in good condition, the front desk people were friendly and accomodating, and I also enjoyed the wine reception. No complaints, and I've stayed in many a hotel over the years I have had of business and leisure travel. I don't believe they have bfrast options, but there are plenty of places within easy walking distance. Free Wi-Fi is a nice touch - plenty of hotels in this category charge for it which always irks me.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a great location. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Located on Market & 4th Street, it was in the middle of the downtown business district & close to restaurants, walking distance to China town and other areas of interest. Free Wi-Fi. Would have preferred the WSJ in the AM instead of the NYT.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was beautiful, as was my room. The free wine made the stay that much better, and the service was great. Would definitely stay here again. My only qualm was the price of parking- it was very expensive, but the front desk told us about a place 2 blocks from the hotel that was cheaper.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, modern and conveniently located. It's as simple as that.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. The location is great just off Market St. for easy transit. It is a boutique hotel more geared to adult travelers than families. For the value and discounted hotel rate, it was well worth the stay.

review.title: Could have been better!
review.reviewText: Upon my arrival, I asked the staff for a room that faces outward. He told me that the room I was assigned faces the courtyard but on a high floor but said that he was going to see what he can find and call me in the room in 30 minutes. An hour passed and I did not hear a thing. It would have been nice for him to follow up even if he was not able to accomodate my request. In addition, inspite of my request of a quiet room, I was given a room next to the Electrical Control Room. You could hear the noise in the room.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: We "splurged" on the executive suite, and it was a fairly large room, but not a king size bed from what we could tell. Also separate "living area" with TV, so if you like to watch tv in bed, this is not the room for you. The staff is extremely nice, very helpful. We enjoyed the wine reception in the evenings. In general, the room lacks a few common ammenities that many larger chains have (i.e. in room coffee maker, fridge etc.) but felt cosier; the staff was very accessible. Nice area, a little noisy if you are a light sleeper (ask for a fan in your room). Would certainly stay again.

review.title: great spot, nice hotel
review.reviewText: Location is perfect for shopping, hotel is quiet in spite of the busy market street below. My room was large and comfortable. Valet parking a bit expensive, French restaurant on 5th is good but a bit expensive too. A lot of other choice for food around anyway.

review.title: has class
review.reviewText: high style, clean, comfortable.

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Palomar five times in the last few years. I used to live in San Francisco and prefer this hotel for its price, location, quality and comfort. I love the fact that I can take BART from SFO to the front door of this hotel. The hotel is convenient to everything I want to do or see. The hotel is always quiet and the rooms are very comfortable and spacious. The beds are the best. I highly recommend the restaurant also. It's well priced and the food is excellent.

review.title: Perfect Palomar
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff...free wifi and wine reception every evening!!! What more do you want....oh yeah a very comy bed and fab shower!!! Well done Palomar!!

review.title: Best stay in San Francisco so far
review.reviewText: Stayed in the Palomar for 6 nights while attending a conference at Moscone. Perfect walking distance to the conference and anywhere else we wanted to go. Rooms were immaculate. The cleaning staff are excellent. There were three of us and the one thing we loved was that our rooms was huge! Plenty of space to walk around and not bump into one another. Breakfast was fine but cost us over $80! It was nearly $20 for an omelette so take a walk to Seers Fine Dining on Powell. The Chancellor Hotel on Powell also has an awesome restaurant for breakfast. Other tasty restaurants we walked to were Plouf (15 min walk), House of Prime Rib (30 min walk), and California Pizza Kitchen just one block over on 3rd Street. I'd highly recommend the Palomar again.

review.title: Extremely well located
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice and extremely well located but it is somewhat small, cold and pompous. No breakfast is included and it's the kind of hotel where you fear being charged for extras if you touch anything in the room. But at the price we booked it for on Expedia, it was still a great deal. No regrets whatsoever.

review.title: extreamly impressed
review.reviewText: i had such a great time at this hotel the staff were very helpful polite made you feel like you were right at home. the rooms were large beds were great. nice and quiet will stay here again i can't wait to go back !!!!!!

review.title: Would not recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location - just off Union Square, but that's all. It is dark, unfriendly place, with unfriendly reception staff and $45 charge for parking per night. And we could never find valet service, even though we paid for it. They simply were not there and it took us some time to wait for the car each time. As we were checking out, you could tell the receptionist could not care less, and even recommended other 4 star hotels nearby. Overall, we wish we could have chosen another hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Fantastic hotel with great location
review.reviewText: My daughter (19) and I booked The Palomar in S.F. and got an amazing rate. It was very convenient to the cable cars and BART, right at Union Square, close to great restaurants and major dept. stores. The beds were among the most comfortable ever and the room was lovely. We liked the fact that it was a boutique hotel, not one of the cookie cutter hotels. Coffee served every morning in the lobby. My daughter loved the fact that the doorman opened the door for her every morning with a cheery "hello." The staff at the front desk ALWAYS said good morning when we'd come and and goodnight at the end of the evening. Nice touch. Rooms very clean and our room (#836) was very quiet. We didn't overlook the main street, but we didn't mind because this meant that there was no noise heard from outside while sleeping. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great City
review.reviewText: This hotel was a joy to stay at. For a business trip, the rooms were good sized, functional and clean. Wireless service quality was excellent and free - something we need as business travellers. The 5th floor breakfast/dinner areas was very good for meetings. The gym was small but functional. The staff were curteous, helpful and happy. The location was central to the convention centre, shopping and restaurants. San Francisco is a beautiful, vibrant and cosmopolitan city.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Definitely one of the best locations in San Francisco. Ideal for Union Square and easy access to all the public transport. Very comfortable hotel and very accomodating staff.

review.title: will defiantly go back.
review.reviewText: City Centre hotel - made the perfect holiday. Rooms pleasant and clean. Staff attentive, friendly and a pleasure to deal with - they helped make the holiday. Would defiantly recommend this hotel although it is probably not suited for children but this is down to the inner city location. A+

review.title: Not a place to stay for a honeymoon.
review.reviewText: Were told we would have a room with a garden view, it was the view of a roof. Not value for money, as the they charge for items that are complimentary in hotels of the same standard and price, e.g. they charged for internet access when there is free wireless. We found the reception very cold/impersonal and too businesslike (remember not everyone is there for a business trip!!). The complimentary tea and coffeee finished an hour earlier than in the brochure and when I rang the recption to ask about this, I was questioned. Staff need to read the brochure.

review.title: I wish I could go back tomorrow!!
review.reviewText: San Francisco is already an amazing place to be, but staying in a hotel as centrally located and as comfortable as the Palomar makes the trip complete. The beds were very comfortable. The flat screen tv was a nice touch. We had a great view of Market Street. The location was impecable. Market Street is full of shops. The MOMA is walking distance, as well as AT&T Park. If you are going somewhere else in the city, the tram is just up the street, and S.F.'s public transit is phenomenal. The restaurant at the Palomar has great drinks and food, and the employees were always very courteous and helpful.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: WE enjoyed staying at the hotel. It is central and convenient.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The big plus to this hotel compared to others is the location. Although getting a cab was a nightmare at any time of day and annoyingly the front desk were keener to provide you a limo at 5x the cab rate. The room was very comfortable, although the towels were small and a little substandard for a premium room. It was sometimes noisy as we were at the front of the hotel from buskers playing on market street, but I'm sure other rooms at the rear/side would be less noisy. The bed was too soft for my wife and I but thats just personal preference. Finally, other than one South African the front desk were pretty clueless about local eateries, so do your own research

review.title: Frequent Visitor
review.reviewText: I often travel to SF on business and this is my hotel of choice. I've been forced to stay in other local hotels due to vacancy and always wish I was back at the Palomar.

review.title: Digital TV average
review.reviewText: The room and service was excellent. Location is good. I was a bit surprised by the quality of the picture (not good) on the digital TV.

review.title: Not too impressed!
review.reviewText: Good that hotel is very central to Union Square. Disappointed that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in rooms. For the whole of my stay - 7 days the ice machine did not work. TV also was not available for 24 hours. For the price of the hotel its the little things that make a pleasant stay and these were lacking.

review.title: Small gorgeous hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel need not to be any larger. How large can a hotel get in downtown San Francisco? The hotel is just as chic and modern as the pictures show. Although, the people at the front desk could use a little peppy-ness, our room and restroom were roomier than expected (maybe because it was handicap-accessible, =) ), the conceirge was extremely helpful, and the newspaper is delivered everyday! I love crosswords. The room has hints of modern animal prints (carpet, robes, ice bucket, sheets) and splashes of bright colors. Just as beautiful as the pictures!

review.title: Great LOCATION!
review.reviewText: This was my second trip to San Francisco and by far the best one. We took the BART from the Airport and got off at Powell, when we went up the escalator, the hotel was less then a block away. This hotel has a wonderful location for using public transportation. The cable car line is 2 blocks and the F Line streetcar is less then a block. Hotel is located in the heart of all the great shopping that Union Square has to offer. The hotel was clean, the beds were comfy and the staff was helpful. I would stay there again.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: Great location, close to BART, Muni, shops, some restaurants. Staff was nice, rooms were very clean. Seemed like a decent value for the area.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: staff courtious and helpful with restaurants and transportation tips. location is extremely convenient and would stay here again just because of this.

review.title: A Definate Must on our next return!
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were awesome. Everyone was so friendly. We loved the daily wine tasting. We will be back.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Has nice wine reception,we personally didn't like the wine but had good turn out of people. Front desk lady gave us good recommendation for restaurant. Lulu, good California cuisine but incredibly noisy! Went to 1984, a dancing club, a really awful dive.

review.title: Great Hotel. Room location and size is important.
review.reviewText: Very classy hotel. This was our second stay at the Palomar. During our first stay we had a larger room that looked out on Market Street and was great. This time we had one of the less expensive rooms which was quite small and looked out over an internal courtyard area. A little claustrophobic, and probably not worth the price. The staff was great and saved the day for a wedding reception we attended. The reception was at an out of the way gallery in the Mission district. When it was time to leave, 23 of us were stranded, as no taxis would respond to our calls. My wife called the Palomar and they arranged for two limos to come pick us up.

review.title: Palomar
review.reviewText: great boutique hotel. conmfortable rooms, good water pressure in showers

review.title: One of the best hotels in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed for one night (to attend a Steely Dan concert in Berkeley) and the hotel was just wonderful. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The location was just steps away from Union Square and all of its glorious shopping, dining and entertainment. (BART was easily accessible as well.) We would love to stay here again on our next visit.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed one night at this hotel and have no complaints. The hotel staff were extremely friendly. Hotel was very clean and Beds were comfortable. We will stay there again if back in the SF area.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: From the doorman to the front desk, everyone was very helpful, friendly and very accomodating. The rooms were very clean well appointed, and a very good value. Will stay there again, most definetly. Rode BART from the East Bay, gets you within a half block of the hotel. Walked to the ballpark, Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square and Embarcadero easily, great location.

review.title: Graet location, good value quality hotel
review.reviewText: Good quality hotel. The rooms were smallish but well appointed. Our room was on the fifth floor closest to the restaurant but we weren't disturbed beyond about 10pm by noise. It certainly wasn't loud at any stage, just laughter from the diners now & then. We only had the one breakfast there and found it to be quite expensive. The high price tag on the continental breakfast had an automatic 17% gratuity added plus tip so overall pretty poor value.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The rooms in the hotel were very nicely decorated but lacked some basics. For example, there was a closet, but no dresser. If you're staying for several days (and there were two of us) living out of your suitcase is very inconvenient. The bed was very uncomfortable and the bathroom door did not close all the way. The room was very small which is not uncommon in San Francisco but if you stay at one of the larger chains such as Hyatt or Hilton the rooms are much larger. The staff is pretty friendly. The location is great. Very close to the MOMA, around the corner from Bloomingdale's, Mel's Drive-In and much more.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean, stylish and comfortable. Well- located in dowtown San Fran.

review.title: Started honeymoon in style!
review.reviewText: My wife and I started our honeymoon in SF and chose the Palomar on a recommendation from one or our SF friends. As New Yorkers, we had rather high expectations -- and they were either met - and in some instances exceeded. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful in every area - like making dinner reservations or finding a great store to shop in. They also upgraded us to a wonderful suite complete with complementary amenities like champagne and strawberries, and a Jacuzzi! The theme of the room was decidedly modern with a whimsical animal accents (leopard and zebra robes for example). Fabulous, comfortable bed and generously large rooms. We are definitely going back and would recommend this hotel without reservation (no pun intended).

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great price, right at the center of downtown (2 blocks from Times Square)...Rooms were very nice and clean and cozy...Would definitely go back again!

review.title: Let down
review.reviewText: Unfortnately, this hotel stay did not live up to the Kimpton name. Our phone did not work the entire stay and we had to beg for new towels. When we complained about a noisy guest the front desk said they sent security up but we waited outside and no one came. Very dissapointed.

review.title: Nicely located in central SF, near public transit [cables cars] and Market Street and Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and conveniently located, staff was friendly and very courteous, nice "lobby amenities" in the morning and at night, room was very comfortable.

review.title: Good Times
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, but the rooms were a little small. Everyone was very friendly and it was in a good location. Would definitely recommend.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Very cute, clean and comfortable hotel. I would definitely go back. It was located in a very convenient location. Very close to shopping, restaurants, etc... Absolutely loved this hotel and the staff were very helpful!

review.title: Good San Fran hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for a long getaway weekend and had a good time. The staff were courteous and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We were only dissappointed by how small the room was- the only drawback. But the location is in the middle of everything: shopping, transportation, restaurants, tourist spots- you can actually walk to everything... so you won't find as nice a hotel for the price in the same location.

review.title: Definitely a Winner!
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Great rooms. Great service.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel, got a good price. Service was Awesome! will be going back again

review.title: Convenient location; nice rooms; friendly staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is located conveniently almost on top of the Powell street BART station, next to the Westfield shopping center and a short walk to Union Square. We were concerned about the prospect of noise but our room was very quiet. It was also nicely decorated and several requests to the staff were promptly accommodated. The wine reception in the afternoon is a nice surprise. Overall, a pleasant stay -- we will return.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location (we walked everywhere or took the streetcars), the staff are really nice and helpful The room is a decent size and the beds are comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: This is a nice comfortable hotel in an excellent central location. Only complaint is that the hotel staff were a bit clueless and didn't seem that bothered about helping us out with any of our enquiries.

review.title: good !
review.reviewText: I had really good stay. room is quiet and comfortable. location was very convenient,

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: I was there only for one night but i absolutely enjoyed it, i hope to come back and stay longer

review.title: Luxury and comfort in one lovely hotel
review.reviewText: This was the perfect choice - with so many hotels in the city to choose from I was delighted with my choice. I was staying there with my husband and my 70 year old mother, at the end of a fabulous trip, so I wanted the holiday to end on a high. We were not disappointed at all. The location of this hotel is unbeatable - just off Market, a main street where trams, metro, BART and buses run to just about all over the city, just around the corner from Westfield Shopping Mall, and only a couple of blocks from Union Square. The rooms are quiet, very comfortable, decorated in a smart, contemporary style with fab beds and crisp, clean linen. The only thing that my mother wanted for was tea/coffee making facilities, but when I mentioned it to the porter who brought our luggage he brought a coffee maker right up to the room at no charge. The bathrooms were a real pleasure to use, with granite basins, fluffy towels and nice toiletries (L'Occitane), and most importantly the shower was excellent. The robes were another nice touch - instead of standard white they are in animal print, which is such a fun idea. The staff on the front desk were super helpful when I needed to make enquiries about a lost passport, so I was really grateful. All in all I would stay here again without any hesitation whatsoever!

review.title: Hotel Palomar - Great service, average room, yet key location
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel property was nice and the staff was VERY attentive and interested in your comfort. They definitely get an "A" for hotel staff and service. On the negative side, the rooms were a bit small and spartan for a higher priced hotel. The Internet service was really slow yet there was an upgrade option to a paid connectivity that helped a little. The location was excellent and proximity to Market and Moscone in the end was worth the premium.

review.title: palomar
review.reviewText: very nice boutique hotel. right in teh middle of the union square, moscone, metreon and sf moma area.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet rooms. Great location. Courteous staff.

review.title: Great location with well appointed rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel desk manager was extremely accomodating and friendly. Was pleased with my stay and would have liked to stay more than the one night I was there for business. Located in the heart of the city's shopping area, blocks away from Union Square, Moscone Center, etc. Great location yet has a small hotel vibe. Free coffee in lobby in the morning, morning newspaper at the door, complimentary wine in early evening. One con- tiny lobby not so condusive for lingering or conversation due to street level noise and air, but that is typical for boutique style hotels. On the flip side, very easy in/out access due to hotel size. CD player in room, ipod alarm clock stero system in room, good mesh ergonomic task chair at desk. Very comfortable bed. Overall, well apointed rooms with a contemporary and comfortable vibe.

review.title: Great Service and Location
review.reviewText: Second time I have stayed at this property and it was as good the second time as it was the first. Staff at this hotel are excellent - really focused on customer service - everyone from the doorman to the housekeeping attendant made me feel welcome. Great location for business or leisure travel.

review.title: The best hotel experience!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the comfort of the room. It felt like a true vacation!! The room service was excellent as well! I will def. stay there again.

review.title: Great Place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would definitively recommend this hotel. It is blocks away from most of the tourist spots. It is also just a corner away from Westfield Center and the shops at Market Street. The service is great and very personalized.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. It is right next to Union Square, a walk away from China Town, and you can easily get to other great SF sites and attractions. The hotel itself was very nice and comfortable.

review.title: convenient, had everything i needed
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a convenient location. Rooms are small but nicely decorated. Free internet in each room was a bonus. The restaurant in the hotel was amazing (try the tasting menu). My only complaint was expensive parking--the valet was $42 daily. You can find garages for a bit cheaper nearby, but you will still have to pay ~$30 daily without in/out privileges.

review.title: Hotel noise
review.reviewText: The hotel room did not look at all like what was shown on the internet. We had to switch rooms in the middle of our stay due to the party the hotel was having in the room next to ours. We were originally given a smoking room even though we requested a non-smoking room.

review.title: great service and super clean. But room was kinda small for this price!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff are professional and room was very clean and in good condition. The only unsatisfaction is that the room was kinda small for the price they ask. Bathroom and bedroom are seperated only by a sliding door, so there is basically only one room...

review.title: Great service, great SF location
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar is strategically located at 4th & Market, across from the Virgin Megastore, and within easy walking distance of downtown shopping and Union Square. Excellent service, surprisingly quiet room. The only oddity was the cheesy make-up mirror, which didn't extend far enough over the vanity (had to crawl in next to the VERY deep whirlpool tub) and didn't have a light. Valet parking under the hotel - they'll hand you bottled water on the way out.

review.title: A long weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I stayed three nights at this hotel and had a very pleasant experience. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is right in the center of all the shopping but on a street that is less congested than the main area. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: moderate sized hotel, excellent staff, excellent restaurant, has a homey feel without the mustiness that some older hotels get, would stromgly recommend it to future guests

review.title: Best Hotel I've Stayed At Anywhere!
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful! My Husband and I were very impressed with the hotel the moment we walked through the door. The staff were courteous and attentive, greeting us personally when we left and returned each day. The room was large, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. We were celebrating our anniversary, so were surprised the very first night upon our return with a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates. Location is excellent, with the F-line half a block from hotel, cable car a block away, Union Square, Museum of Modern Art and Chinatown all within walking distance. We've stayed at several boutique hotels and this tops them all!

review.title: Not worth all the money
review.reviewText: The building is really nice and the atmosphere is great... but I was in a room right next to the gym and after 5.30AM I had no way to sleep as it was extremely noisy. They should charge half the money for a room like that (you only get to sleep up to when the first guest decides to hit the treadmill). The room itself is super-small and there is no coffe machine inside. You basically have to pay a rate that covers the maintenance of a beautiful building but don't get much out of it.

review.title: Extremely Disappointed
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed and was sorry I didn't stay somewhere else. Service was mediocre at best. The rooms are very, very small and the bathrooms are as well. This was also the most I have ever paid for parking in San Francisco. The room service menu had few choices and the sheets were low thread count. When I tried to upgrade the person helping me told me the only difference would be a a nicer bathtub, that the room size would be the same. When I got home and checked the website I saw that there was a big difference in the room size and I would have been happy to spend the extra money. I would not reccommend this hotel and I will definitely not being staying there again.

review.title: Very nice, and perfect location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and well kept. All the employees were very friendly. My favorite feature was the quick access to shopping in SF.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The service and cleanliness impressed us most!

review.title: Excellent location for accessing downtown San Francisco by foot
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and well designed rooms. Excellent location on Market Street for accessing all the amenities of downtown San Francisco. Ideal for both the business traveller and tourist. Within short walking distance of the financial area. A large number of department stores (including Macy's, Abercrombie and Fitch, Nordstrom and Bloomingdales) and many tourist attractions ( Powell and Market cable car) are literally on your doorstep. Furthermore, it is in a superb position for accessing the BART and other public transport services.

review.title: Slept on sofa bed the first night
review.reviewText: After traveling a long way, we arrived to find the hotel overbooked and we had to stay in a room that had a sofa bed instead of a regular bed. The sofa bed was really bad and so was the first night. I still don't understand how the hotel overbooked a "reserved" room. We received a credit from Expedia and a complimentary breakfast from Hotel Palomar. The second day we moved to the type of room I had reserved but the bed was not comfortable at all. The staff is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and the hotel is convenient to everything in San Francisco. Unfortunately, we will remember the Hotel Palomar for the horrible first night.

review.title: Nicely appointed
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful small hotel. Its restaurant has an excellent wine list, and its staff goes out of its way to be helpful. My only complaint is that the doorman freely offers to valet park your vehicle without disclosing unusually high parking rates ($42 per day, most of which is charged in the first few hours).

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally located and the rooms were comfortable despite being small. My only negative feedback would be the hotel service. I found the frontdesk staff to be slightly rude and the concierage never seemed to be available.

review.title: You Won't Be Disappointed
review.reviewText: Bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in I think. Pillows were awesome, too! They are stingy with the bath towels and replacing bath products each day, however, even with writing a note to housekeeping. Comfort was top notch, service so so. Location was perfect. Had to ask for a coffee maker for our room. We tried the coffee in the lobby the first morning and it was empty and the decaf was cold.

review.title: Small Luxurious Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located in Downtown and it's in a great location. The hotel is small and has a tiny lobby area but it's really personal and beautifully designed.

review.title: great location and helpful staff
review.reviewText: very nice and comfortable

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: great location, fairly big and quiet rooms, great valet parking service, nice and helpful staff

review.title: Great location, very good value
review.reviewText: My wife and I were very happy with the Hotel Palomar experience. Great location for shopping. Hotel staff were very helpful with restaurant reservations and tour organizations.

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Palomar several times and have never been disappointed. The staff are unfailingly courteous, rooms well-appointed and comfortable. If only they'd add premium cable channels to their offerings it'd be perfect!

review.title: Nice but not worth it
review.reviewText: The Hotel isn't bad. However, it's located in front of a bus stop that is always crowded and over an Old Navy Store. The entrance to the hotel leaves much to be desired. It feels like you're still standing out in the street with the people waiting for the bus. The hotel restaurant is super expensive as is room service. Example... $5 bag of chips. For the kind of money you spend here you can definitely go somewhere else that is not so gritty.

review.title: Stylish, Upscale Property in Great Location
review.reviewText: We loved everything about this hotel. It was surprisingly stylish and upscale. Every staff member we dealt with, from front desk to concierge to maid were more than helpful. Great location just off of the noise of Market Street and near all public transportation. I travel to NYC most weeks and this was a welcome relief from the typical NYC "boutique" in room size, amenities, staff friendliness. Highly recommend it for business or leisure travel.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: I just got back from my first trip to San Francisco, and this hotel was excellent! The location was perfect, and the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly! The room was clean, and bigger than I expected. The beds were also very comfortable! The service of this hotel was above any other hotel I've stayed in before. The next time I visit San Francisco, I'll be staying here again!

review.title: Great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: We've always stayed in different hotels when in San Francisco, but in the future will stay at the Hotel Palomar. The staff was very helpful and friendly, room comfortable and well maintained, and the location can't be beat!

review.title: We loved the Palomar
review.reviewText: The best part about Hotel Palomar is the location - right off Market St in the heart of Union Square. It's a short walk to all of the shops, trolley turnaround, and ample coffee shops and dining. We though the staff was great - knowledgeable about the local hot spots very accommodating to our requests. Only complaint is that our room was a little on the small side, which doesn't matter too much because you don't need a lot of time in the room when you're in SF. We also had a room facing the atrium so street noise wasn't a problem.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: I have stayed at many different hotels in SF. Pretty much a different one on each visit. I have definitely found my new hotel! The price was comparable to some of the boutiques, but the quality was above and beyond.

review.title: Excellent service!
review.reviewText: Great Service--really enjoyed the hotel. Would go back.

review.title: Hotel Palomar is a great hotel!! I will definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were great and the bed was very comfortable. My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Hotel Palomar and will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Wonderful Hotel, Great Value!
review.reviewText: We were almost reluctant to stay at this hotel because the price was so good. (We thought "Too good to be true") It turns out it afforded us every luxury that could be expected from a 4-star hotel, including turndown service at night. The location was excellent, it was quiet and comfortable, and we were 100% pleased with every aspect of the stay. We look forward to returning to a Kimpton Hotel in the future. PS- The staff was extraordinarily nice! :)

review.title: good value for money
review.reviewText: not impressed by the lobby but the rooms are nice and well furnished; good location

review.title: san fran stay
review.reviewText: good hotel

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Great service and location

review.title: Great hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable, easily accessible from all MUNI lines, clean and the staff were friendly.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel !!!
review.reviewText: Wow, what a stay we had at this hotel! Everyone bent over backwards for us. Not a single complaint from us. Very comfortable beds, lots of hot water and guest services at our fingertips. They even suggested restaurants and evening activities. They also checked out places to see what was available. Love this place and the staff.

review.title: Great location & nice rooms!
review.reviewText: I was really pleased with Hotel Palomar. It was located right next to Union Square and all the great shopping. It is 1 block from the BART station to the airport. The rooms are fun and contemporary. The staff was very attentive. I would highly recommend!

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: To begin with, the hotel staff are very friendly and always helpful. The room was clean and satisfied our basic needs. The bed was comfortable although the pillows were a bit small. The internet speed was a bit sluggish but it's free, and who cares when you're on holidays.

review.title: Nice, clean boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great central location right off Market St. around the corner from Westfield Shopping Center. A stroll of a couple short blocks to the Moscone Convention Center and several blocks from Union Square. Room was on the small side but adequate for a solo business traveler. One odd observation -- toilet was quite noisy and loud in operation.

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: This was my second time staying at Hotel Palomar. I love this hotel! Great location. Lovely rooms.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Yes, a very enjoyable stay at the Palomar. Friendly staff, clean and efficient. Very centrally located. Just beware of their phone and web rates in the business centre.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I planned a very last minute trip to San Francisco over Memorial Day weekend. Making reservations the night before we arrived, many of the hotels were full. We didn't want to spend a lot of money and found Hotel Palomar to be exactly what we were looking for. The hotel was a little tricky to find but what a terrific location - right on Market Street with shopping all around! The room was very nice, clean and comfortable. They even have a "turn down" service with a chocolate on your pillow. All this for last minute reservations and a super reasonable price! We will definately come back to this hotel on our next trip down.

review.title: Great location; slight noise complaint
review.reviewText: This is a "boutique" hotel. You get the same room and bed as the bigger one accross the street without the big lobby. Service was okay once they answered the phone. You can't beat the location. From the hotel you can walk to the best shopping, transportation (MUNI), entertainment, and restaurants. We did have some noise problems at night when we stayed. We could hear doors slamming and a party down the hall.

review.title: Nice but small
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and nicely decorated, and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Our only complaint was that the room was very small. However, we have stayed in San Francisco several times and most of our rooms have been fairly small. Due to the smallness of the room, the bathroom opened right up into the bed. Therefore, there was only a sliding door which was rather bulky to slide back and forth.

review.title: Great Hotel! Great Location! Great to our Dog!
review.reviewText: We stay at a lot of hotels that "allow dogs" and it is common that you get one of the "dog rooms." Not so at the Palomar... our room was just as nice as any room with or without a dog. The staff was extremely polite and kind both to us and our dog (65 lb lab mix). The location was right off Market and a few minute walk to Union Square. It was also about a 10 min walk to the Ferry Terminal... really convenient. If you are traveling with your dog, I would absolutely recommend this place. Even if you weren't it is still a great hotel. It's no huge hotel with 100's of rooms... it is small and intimate. They have valet parking in a private underground lot that costs about 40/day... typical of San Francisco.

review.title: Very Boring Hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel does not seem like a hotel but more like a dormitory. It has no bar and no soul.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a classy hotel in a great location, with outstanding staff. The room was very comfortable and beautifully appointed. I found the hallways a bit dark and the hotel internet in the business office a bit pricey. We did not have an opportunity to use the restaurant, which was very quiet when we passed by. I would definitel stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel! The staff were very helpful and friendly. They recomended excellent restaurants and gave good tips about the City. The rooms were clean and well maintained. We would not hesitate to stay at this Hotel again!

review.title: will be back
review.reviewText: awesome location and the staff is suburb.I will definitely be going back! The staff was also very gay friendly and at no time did my girlfriend and I feel out of place or unwelcome.We checked in late after 10pm we asked for a late check out of day rental and they gave us till 6pm the next day, very fair

review.title: Great Hotel, Green Staff
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was great. The room and amenities were very nice, the room was very clean and everything was in working order. (The bathtub/shower drain was rather slow - but no big deal really. On arrival, their computer system wasn't working properly - it wouldn't complete the authentication of the guests' credit cards, so the service reps took a photo copy of my credit card so they could validate the details later. That made me a bit nervous given the risk of identity theft these days. The receptionn staff was young, nice, and pleasant, but not really all that helpful. The housekeeping staff was a bit too aggressive with their turndown service.

review.title: Great place to stay, probably worth the cost
review.reviewText: Excellent location, knowledgeable and friendly service, rooms very clean, free WiFi. Minor cons: room service card indicated we could order food before 7am, but then got a call that morning that said the kitchen didn't open before 7am. Also, my complimentary shoe shine was poor.

review.title: I keep going back
review.reviewText: This is a wonderfully located and pleasant hotel. Staff are helpful and friendly. Room service actually tastes like something.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: We switched to this hotel from a larger hotel at the airport. Nice, but a little disappointed so we booked at this boutique hotel. Small rooms, but that was to be expected. Loved the location the hotel's service was exceptional. My husband really liked the hotel. Bathrooms were really nice - not lots of privacy, but granite countertops and very clean. Loved the robes and towels. Would stay here again.

review.title: Hotel Palomar
review.reviewText: Location was the most convenient attribute of this hotel. The staff was also great and made my stay very comfortable.

review.title: Excellent Hotel Stay -
review.reviewText: This hotel is located near everything! Shopping, Chinatown, The warf is only a short trolley ride down Market Street. The accommodations were excellent. The staff went out of their way to assist you with any request. They go above and beyond to make your stay exceptional. The room and bed was very comfortable and I would stay at this hotel again - without hesitation.

review.title: Beautiful boutique hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed there for one night and loved the hotel. It's adorable and a very convenient walk to Union Square.

review.title: It was OK for the most part
review.reviewText: Everything was nice. The room service was expensive, but still pretty good. It's in a good location in the center of the city. This is the bad part: I asked, even called, to make sure I got a seperate bed from my brother, as we were visiting an uncle from Oakland. When we got there....it was one bed. And they wouldn't accommodate us. It was one of those deals where they purposefully don't have specifics in the bedding situation. It's like, you take it or leave...even if you've called ahead. The explanation was very odd. So while a great hotel, considering it's small size, I'd recommend to most people.....as long as they are singles, married, or they are dating someone. Don't share a room with a relative, if you like your personal space....as much as I do.

review.title: Great boutique hotel close to Union Square shopping, convenient to therest of the City
review.reviewText: Great location, easy to get around. Close to Market Street and Union Square. Walk to Chinatown and easy cab or bus to Castro, etc. Nice room, nicely decorated, including common areas, etc. Helpful and friendly hotel staff. Very responsive when i needed little things, like a vase for some flowers or when the cable went on the fritz. In both instances they were there "now" with what I needed.

review.title: Kimpton Hotels are amazing!
review.reviewText: I loved staying at the Palomar in San Francisco. We were there 7 nights, had a small but very quiet, clean, modern room. I enjoyed every aspect of this hotel's service. I've read many reviews which mention the staff's friendliness and helpfulness. My stay was no exception. I would stay at the Palomar again in a heartbeat, and would choose a Kimpton Hotel if going to another city solely based on my experience at the Palomar.

review.title: Comfortable hospitality
review.reviewText: Small size operation makes the services friendly.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, close to everything, and a great starting point for exploring the city. The staff was very helpful and the concierge gave us a lot of great tips and directions. Room was nice but not large. The beds were very comfortable. Great Aveda bath products.

review.title: Excellent service, comfort, and class
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar is an excellent place to stay in SF. I would go back there no matter what the price in the future. The bell and front desk staff are incredibly friendly, especially Ernest, and really know the area for the best hidden restaurant gems. It is a smaller property so you really get special attention. It is worth it.

review.title: Excellent Hotel... Loved it!
review.reviewText: I took my boyfriend to San Francisco for his birthday because he had never been. The ambiance is very romantic. The Hotel Palomar's location was terrific!! Right in the middle of everything! The room decor was very cute. The bed and pillows were soft and comfortable. They clean your room and make your bed while you're away. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. TERRIFIC hotel... Would definately stay again! Can't wait to go back!

review.title: I can't recommend it.
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel when it first opened 5 years ago and I was amazed at the quality of this place. The beds and linens were amazing,the rooms had cd and dvd players the aveda products. But now 5 years later this place has not aged well. First thing is the missing cd player. Then the furniture and beds do not seem to have been changed since they originally placed there. The thing that would keep me coming back is the location's convenience. Other than that I can't recommend this hotel.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a 1/2 block from the BART. You can get from the airport to the hotel in about 20-25 minutes for $5.15. Much better than a cab. Also, the cable cars are 1/2 block away. You can take the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf and many other attractions. No need to rent a car or take a cab.

review.title: Awesome location!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Palomar for two nights. We took the BART from SFO(about 30 minutes). Exiting from the Powell station, the hotel was right in front of us. It's a block or two away from Union Square. Checking in was a cinch. Our room was on the top floor. It didn't look out into the street, but we didn't mind not hearing any traffic. The front desk was very helpful. If you're planning on going to a Giants game, you can walk to the park. It only took about 15 minutes. The bed was really comfortable. I loved getting Aveda products to use. I would totally stay there again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar is extremeley comfortable and a great location. Parking is a little pricey, but almost everywhere in the city is. Our room was quite spacious compared to other Kimpton hotels I have stayed in.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: This hotel should be considered for a 5 star hotel. The staff was great, all amenities were covered. The location was a short walk to the shopping at Union Square and the cable cars at Powell Street. The rooms were finely appointed and very comfortable. We loved this hotel and cannot wait to come back to SF. We will stay at other Kimpton properties because of this hotel. We did not get to try the restaurant, but will when we come back.

review.title: Great Location and Helpfule Staff
review.reviewText: It was in a great location. The only thing is that the bar/restaurant was closed our entire stay (3 nights) for a private party. The staff was very professional and curtious. We would go back.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful Hotel. Lobby is small.The staff is very friendly and helpful.The valet parking is expensive,but there is public parking available a block away.

review.title: the best hotel in SF
review.reviewText: will visit again

review.title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice boutique hotel. Rooms are somewhat small, but very comfortable. Service and staff were helpful and accomadating. Would recommend this hotel to others, especially for a weekend getaway to SF as the location is perfect for seeing all different parts of the city by walking or through public transportation.

review.title: Hidden costs
review.reviewText: I found the Hotel Palomar to be a well located, clean, as well as a trendy hotel. What I did not like was the fact no one tells you the cost to park you car until checkout. A whopping $45 dollars a night!!!! Also to note that the walls between each room are very thin! We had a family with a young baby in the next room to us, and the child was up at 6PM screaming or yelling, for which we heard every sound the child made. Also they take $300 dollars in "advance" charges on your credit card, even if you have already paid for your room. They do have a gym with modern equipment, but it was the size of a closet! Overall I felt that the hotel had too many hidden costs, plus with the thin walls this hotel would not be a place to say in the future.

review.title: Awesome hotel!
review.reviewText: This is the second Kimpton hotel I've stayed in, and I couldn't be more pleased. The staff is great, the amenities wonderful, and the location just perfect. The Palomar hotel has a great bar and restaurant that you should check out. It's one block from Union Square, so it's next to everything you could want/need.

review.title: Contemporary swank, yet unpretentious
review.reviewText: From the phone calls I made before I arrived to the onsite staff, everyone was lovely and helpful. One great perk is their yoga basket, which they provide for your use along with the free yoga channel to have an in-room class. I am allergic to feathers, and they very promptly accomodated my request without fuss (unlike another swanky SF hotel in January). Their coffee was great, and they have wine in the evenings (although I didn't get to that). BIG PLUS: Not only the Aveda products, but their towels-they were soft and not at all thin and bleached stiff to mimic a giant loofa. They were wonderful. I think the hotel is perfectly situated to easily take in all of SF. I will definitely stay again (or at any other Kimpton hotel.

review.title: great SF boutique hotel - we are hooked on the kimpton brand
review.reviewText: i searched forever for the right boutique hotel in SF - as there are a ton. this is an amazing 4-star hotel pretty much in the heart of SF - right on market street, and you can walk to the buena gardens, the ferry building, and pretty much anywhere else on that side of town - as long as you're up for a little exercise.

review.title: Great Boutique Hotel!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel! Top-notch staff, friendly and courteous. Very ecclectic and elegant decor, wonderful beds and linens, nicely appointed rooms. I will definetely stay here again!

review.title: Exceptionally pleasant experience
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Palomar while we spent 5 vacation days in San Francisco. We were extremely pleased overall with this hotel. The hotel was exceptionally clean and very quiet. Our room overlooked a beautiful interior rock garden with bamboo. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel staff turned it down for us daily. The concierge was very helpful in recommending a small tour company that used a small van rather than some huge bus. The tours that we took - Sonoma and Napa wine country, the Muir Woods and the city of S.F. were great. There were several places to eat close by and the public transportation was a half a block away. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Many pleasant surprise !!
review.reviewText: Nicely decorated, very clean, all employee will say Hello. Small lobby is the biggest drawbacks but I will go back again.

review.title: Hotel Palomar worth a visit
review.reviewText: Upon arriving at the Hotel Palomar, my wife and I were overwhelmed with smiling faces, kind words and helping hands. Once checked in, we took the elevator to our room. Overlooking a well maintained courtyard, our room was quite comfortable and spacious. Overall we are extremely happy we found this beautiful hotel in such close proximity to fine dining, entertainment and Union Square. We highly recommend this fine establishment!

review.title: Convenient and comfy!
review.reviewText: First time to San Fransicso, got off the very convenient BART, turned around and there was our hotel. Was an awesome place to stay, just steps from all the shops but being around the corner seemed to insulate it from the worst of city noise. Very clean, nicely appointed.

review.title: Very nice small hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel Palomar is a very nice small hotel, with friedly, professional service and eager staff. My room was just the right size for one traveler, but may have been cramped for two. The hotel is conveniently located near the convention center. The only drawback I saw was that breakfast service was too late to accommodate convention schedules.

review.title: Friendly staff, excellent location, highly recommended
review.reviewText: Overall the staff was extremely helpful, friendly, and accommodating. The doormen are always there to greet you with a big smile. The concierge was the only shortfall. He seemed very knowledgeable but didn't follow-through with his promise to provide us with information we requested. The rooms are well appointed, serviced twice daily, and very well kept - albeit a little on the smaller side (it is SF after all). We had a room overlooking Market and there was very little if any noticeable street noise. Make sure to check out the Thirsty Bear Restaurant and Brewery only a couple blocks away - amazing food, fun atmosphere.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: this hotel is in a great location. all was satisfactory,just keep in mind that all rooms don't have wifi, my only disappointment with the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, great location - even with kids
review.reviewText: Good hotel in central location, extremely friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Spacious room and comfortable bed
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was couteous and helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bed was great - big and soft. The only downside was that it was on a very busy corner downtown SF. That made coming and going hectic. But once you were in the hotel, it was comfortable.

review.title: Great artsy hotel atop Old Navy in middle of shopping haven!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Very friendly staff. Excellent concierge. Great exterior view of the big city life. Excellent breakfast room service, very tasty yet a tad pricey, but expected. Plenty to do around this hotel. Had a great street view with the Apple store and Virgin megastore right out our window (not a bad thing), floor to ceiling drapes made for great privacy. Besides occasional street noise and fire trucks, etc, room was surprisingly quiet. Very clean room, high style and soft sheets. Exceeded expectations, although room was a tad small and could use a fridge that is not the mini-bar.

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and very comfortable.

review.title: Great little hotel! Great location!
review.reviewText: The staff was very courteous and helpful, the room quite nice and the restaurant on the 5th floor fabulous. All San Francisco public transportation was within a block and great shopping within walking distance. I would definitely recommend staying at the Hotel Palomar!

review.title: great experience all around
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and accomodating, the room was a little on the small side, but extremely nice. We would definitely stay there again. Just a tip though, if you drive in from the 80, once you turn off of Market onto 4th street, the hotel is immediatley on your right. If you pass it, you'll spend another half hour crawling around the block on one way streets. Also, 24 hour parking (with no in/outs) is $20 cheaper two blocks away at the Metreon parking structure (I think it's called the Metreon, something like that). All in all though, an awesome hotel.

review.title: Great hotel and restaurant is a big bonus
review.reviewText: A wonderful 2-night stay, quiet, comfortable, attractive, great food, excellent service, nice little fitness room with good quality cardio equipment (a rarity in hotels!). This will be my new standard San Fran hotel pick

review.title: a great time
review.reviewText: It was short, but very sweet. Our meal in the restaurant was expensive but good (just breakfast), the room was very comfortable (besides the slightly sagging bed - which was great, except for the sag), and the overall experience was just what we needed.

review.title: ideal location
review.reviewText: Location was ideal. Rooms were very stylish with lots of flair. I had two huge windows overlooking market Street and up to Union Square with bright sunlight streaming in. One block from SF MOMA art museum and Yuerba Buena Gardens. Lobby was minimal, but this hotel houses one of San Fran's top restaurants, "Fifth Floor". I would definitely return.

review.title: Great loaction, service & value
review.reviewText: Stayed as tourist for three days in September. Great service and extremely friendly and helpful staff from the front desk through to service. Hotel is extremely well positioned in relation to shopping and transportation. The room was extremely comfortable with quality fittings and the bed, what a bed and the pillows I was very reluctant to get up in the mornings and do the sight seeing thing. Free high speed Internet was a real plus.

review.title: Orpheum Tickets? The Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: We are a mature couple who was gifted tickets to the regal and lavish Orpheum Theater. The Palomar location is perfect--right on the corner of Market and 4th Street! It's a $5 cab ride to theaters (and next door to Union Square!) The Palomar staff is the BEST part of the stay! They were full of advice and humor even in the very upscale restaurent on the 5th floor. The room was immaculate and silent with fresh air on demand. I could have stayed in that bed all day--ooooh, the pillows!

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff. I would definitely stay there again. Only drawback was that there didn't seem to be much drawer space for clothing (at least in my room), so it might be inconvenient if you're staying more than a few days and want to unpack a lot of clothing.

review.title: Charming and Convenient
review.reviewText: THe hotel was great. Conveniently located aroung the corner from the BART/Muni Station and a i/2 block away from the Cable Car Depot. The Hotel itself was top notch, room was clean and spacious and it had many immenities. The service was also 1st rate. Free coffee and tea in the morning made the day a little easier to start. Staff was very helpful with directions and locations of sites.

review.title: Great hotel in nice shopping area
review.reviewText: Very pleased with this hotel. Staff were extremely pleasant. Room was quiet and clean with nice linens on the bed. Great area to stay if you want to go shopping!! Also close to public transportation.

review.title: Enjoyed this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is very centrally located - near to shopping, theaters and all Bart and cable car lines. Clean, nice hotel and quiet inside.

review.title: hotel gem near moscone
review.reviewText: We stayed five nights and will undoubtedly stay here again.

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: This was my 2nd trip to San Francisco, & I was very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were very clean, the people at the front desk were very friendly, & the hotel was beautifully decorated. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText: The Palomar has a great location, nice rooms with extra features (CD player with old-school Jazz already prepped when we showed up), and great service. They managed to be elegant without being snobby. I'd highly recommend them again.

review.title: Wonderful atmosphere
review.reviewText: Extremely comfortable bed, well appointed room, great attention to detail and the 5th floor restaurant was amazing.

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed this lovely small hotel 2 blocks from Union Square. Easy to find, right by BART and Muni, and in one of the greatest cities in North America. Our only complaint was the slow service for Sunday breakfast in the hotel restaurant, and the fact that the food came swimming in fat.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Convienient for business travel at a good value.

review.title: Good stuff!
review.reviewText: I'd go back!

review.title: Wonderful service
review.reviewText: We spent the weekend here for our anniversary, and enjoyed impeccable service from the moment we arrived. The concierge, in particular, made an extra effort to make our stay special. Very highly recommended!

review.title: Best value for money
review.reviewText: It is in the centre of SF, close to everything, with a very good concierge

review.title: Loved the Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable

review.title: Very impressed--I will go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very conveniently located on Market Street with easy access to Union Square and all of the good shopping and dining.  The room was excellent as was the hotel staff.

review.title: Friendly & Helpful service
review.reviewText:
Me & my wife spent X'mas holiday over there as tourists. We appriciate nice & friendly service from front desk people. The room is very comfortable with all quality furniture especially bed & pillows that make us sleep very comfortably after traveling for whole day. The location of this hotel is the best that we can enjoy shopping and also closed and easy to take all kinds of transportation. 

The reason that we should this hotel before visiting is " this is the only one hotel in Union Squar area that provide FREE INTERNET HIGH SPEED " which is the best choice for anyone who have to do business on your lap-top while traveling.

review.title: Hotel Palomarvelous
review.reviewText: The hotel is hip, modern and centrally located! You can easily walk to major tourist sights and the Bart System. The staff always greeted me with a happy hello! I enjoyed the bathroom toiletries which were Aveda products.  I slept very well, the beds are super comfortable and the linens are so soft! My most favorite part was when I would return to my room later in the day, to find my bed turned down for the evening and the radio lightly playing jazz music. Each evening I looked forward to hearing the sound of soulful music filling my room. It made my busy schedule come to a closure and made my stay feel like home away from home!

review.title: Great Location, Hip Decor, Quiet Rooms
review.reviewText: Great location,convenient to Union Square, Metrione, Chinatown and public transportation.  The decor is cool and our room faced a courtyard, so it was extremely quiet.

review.title: very nice accomodations centrally located
review.reviewText: my wife and i stayed at the palomar for 3 nights in december. the hotel is a little gem, nicely appointed clean modern rooms and friendly staff.  the dark hallways add to the cozy ambiance and the funky leopard skin carpet gave our room some personalty. the second you step outside the hotel you are in the heart of the hustle and bustle of san francisco's union square neighborhood. lots of shopping and restaurants. our only complaint  was with the thermostat in our room. no matter how high we made it the room stayed chilly.  we were too busy to complain but i feel confident the staff would have attended to our needs.

review.title: On my next visit my first choice will be the Hotel Palomar!
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly efficient and courteous. They gave us suggestions made reservations for restaurants and booked tours. We had no worries about times or places to go. With there knowledgable information we were always on the go to tour beautifulwe San Francisco and then retire in ther Hotel Palomars comfy rooms.

review.title: Will return again
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay with Hotel Palomar

review.title: Our favorite place to stay in SF
review.reviewText:
I often joke to my husband that if I can't stay at the Palomar, I won't go to San Francisco. The last time we traveled to the Bay Area, I had to face reality: The Palomar was sold out! So we stayed at another hotel, and we regretted it. We missed everything about the Palomar the whole time we were there.

The rooms are done in a sedate (not cutesy or garish) boutique style. The lobby is small but personal, 
and the staff are unfailingly pleasant. We *love* being steps from the Muni/BART subway -- it makes getting to and from the airport (and visiting friends in the East Bay or San Francisco's neighborhoods) a snap.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely fabulous! Very classy and elegant with excellent customer service.

review.title: Great discovery
review.reviewText: Perfect accommodations and great location. Walking distance to most points of interest. Fantastic restaurant. My new home when I visit San Francisco.
